Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Ramon_from_Boston
Reviews.Content: Great resort for extended vacations. Very friendly personnel, quiet rooms and accessible to shopping centers and attractions. The villas are kind out-dated and need some care. The facilities and pool are great. You have direct access to the hotel's private beach. Compared to the other Hyatt Vacation Resorts, this could be a 5 in the scale to 10. The area is great, location is superb but the rooms need some care.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here every summer! fully stocked Kitchen!”
Reviews.Author: NorbetBooks
Reviews.Content: We stay her every summer and get the 2 bedroom with kitchen fully stocked, washer dryer, jacuzzi on the beach olympic pool and exercise room.

Reviews.Title: “Own Two Weeks Here”
Reviews.Author: travelgreattimes
Reviews.Content: I have always used my weeks. This place is wonderful and I have now reserved the weeks of June 2 thru 9 and July 28 thru August 4, 2012. You will love the Atlantic Ocean and beach view from my 6th floor balconies. Each apartment has two balconies. Each apartment sleeps up to 8 people. This is a great experience for nature lovers and beach goers. The beach is a stone throw away and the breeze is so pleasant. Dorado offers great restaurants, magnificent golf, great supermarket, unique location near San Juan so you can visit the Fortress, the Old San Juan and best restaurants in the Carribbean. You will get a great value for a full week of fun. If you want my personal review please contact me at jormalv@aol.com. Thanks and enjoy the review.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for a place to relax in the sun...”
Reviews.Author: DoradoLover
Reviews.Content: this is the place for you. We came as part of the Vacation Club in April 2012. This is a beautiful ocean front property with a large pool, kiddie pool, hot tub (which was nice and clean), spa, fitness center and a private beach with just enough surf to make it fun for younger kids. The hotel was only about 1/3 occupied, so there was no need to "stake out" beach chairs or pool chairs. All rooms face the ocean/pool. However, lower level rooms get a view a bit blocked by palm trees (we were on the 6th floor of 8...perfect) and rooms to the far left (as you face the hotel) get a partial view of the abandoned hotel next door. The pool and beach area has a lot of space with plenty of shade in the form of palm trees and umbrellas to complement the sun-lover areas. At night or after it rains, the palm trees come alive with bird calls and coqui. We had a 2 bedroom suite, which sleeps 8 for two adults and two teens (16 and 17.) The suite room has a bathroom/shower, jacuzzi tub, full kitchen, living/dining room with pull-out, balcony seating 4 and bedroom with king bed. The 1 bedroom/studio has considerably less space...bed, pull-out, microwave, mini-fridge, bathroom/shower, balcony. Both rooms have access to washer/dryer. The rooms were clean, quiet and relatively well maintained. The bathrooms do show their age a little bit. There is a small though pretty well stocked market store on the property with basics (milk, bread, soda, etc.) and pool/ocean toys. There is an outdoor bar that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner with limited hours, but no restaurant on property. You will need a car if you stay here. There are no restaurants/activities/grocery within walking distance. The hotel does provide some tour information/sign up, but it's pricey. There are several good restaurants in Dorado (The Greenhouse, Made in PR, Faccio Pizza), a SuperMax grocery, etc. We ate a few meals in town but spent most of the week exploring in the afternoons so we ate in Old San Juan and in other parts of the island. It is a bit of a drive to get to Old San Juan or other points of interest (National Rainforest, Ponce, etc.) If you enjoy resorts buzzing with activity, this is probably not the place for you. However, if you're looking for a peaceful, relaxing place to stay as a jumping off point for your adventures in PR, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: CricketNut91
Reviews.Content: We have been owners at the Hacienda Del Mar for 12 years, so we are well aware of the history concerning the Hyatt Cerromar closing several years ago, along with most of the restaurants and the river pool. We decided to return this year, after a 2-year absence, because we had heard that things were happening next door (the old Hyatt Dorado). The grounds of the property are still impeccably maintained, as was our unit (we have a 2-bedroom). At the owners meeting last Monday morning we were told that plans are underway for redecorating the rooms. However, despite some prior reviews saying the decor is "dated" we feel that the units are still in excellent shape. We also learned at the owners' meeting that the Fairmount organization has recently decided that they are not interested in being the operator of the hotel that will be at the site of the old Cerromar and that the developer of the project, which is the property of the former Dorado and Cerromar, is looking for a new operator. Let me just digress for a moment and say that we drove around the old Dorado site, which is heavily under construction! Major events are happening there - it will reopen in December 2012 as a Ritz Carlton resort and it looks like it will be amazing. We were even able to have dinner at the beachfront restaurant Friday night. We hope that the rebirth of the Dorado will have a very positive effect on the Hacienda Del Mar. Once the Ritz Carlton/Dorado is open, the developer hopes to build a 400-room hotel and casino at the old Cerromar property. The new hotel, however, will be adjacent to the golf course, not on top of the Hacienda like the old hotel is. Anyway - we found that there was more activity this year at the Hacienda than at any year we have gone after the hotel closed. While it was far from crowded, we noticed that there was a variety of guests - seniors, families with children of all ages, couples, and a couple groups of spring-breakers who behaved very well! I must say, when we were there 2 years ago it was a little dead with no kids for our kids to pal around with. It is nice to go somewhere and not have to get up at 7am to put towels on the chairs so you have a spot at the beach or the pool. The hotel still has the Blu Bohio, which serves breakfast, lunch and dinner (make sure you check the dinner hours). Food and drinks were very good, with a nice variety. I think someone's grandmother was in the back making the rice and beans - they were amazing! We had a car, so we were able to stock up at the nearby Amigo supermarket, and we also had dinner at the Chop House (sushi), La Terratza (great mofongo) and the Metropol (?) - a Puerto Rican and Cuban place in the shopping center that has the Starbucks. All in all, we are very hopeful that the Hacienda Del Mar is on its way back to being the preferred destination of 10 years ago. As I said above, it is still carefully maintained, with plans for improvement underway. We know that some of the owners have given up and relinquished their rights to their timeshare - we are very happy that we have stuck it out and are looking forward to our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Property in a Remote Location”
Reviews.Author: ViajeNut
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Hacienda Del Mar, a vacation club property, in February 2012 for some R&R and my Wife's B'Day. The property is about a half hour drive from San juan Int'l. I had a rental car because a cab ride is allegedly $50 each way. The property is located in Dorado, which is a suburb about 20 minutes from the tourist section of Condado and Old San Juan. Because of that, If your looking for excitement and lots of activity, this isn't the place for you!!!!! Overall, this is a solid, well-maintained property. The rooms and grounds are clean and the staff is pleasant. However, the resort is dated and in need of an update. I had a 1 bedroom villa with a spacious living area and master suite. Everything was in working order, clean and functional; just not very modern. Since I had a full kitchen, I stocked up on water and a small amount of groceries from a local supermarket. We did half our dining in the room and half at the resort and around the neighborhood. I would definitely recommend El Vacahon, a neighborhood restaurant. Its absolutely fantastic!!! Also, i would recommend Zafra, an upscale restaurant in Plantation Village, a neighboring golf club location. There is only 1 restaurant on site and it closes early!!! We ate there a few times. It had a typical beach bar and grill menu with a Latin Flair. The food was good, but nothing to go crazy over. The pool area was large and there were plenty of seats available no matter what time of day. The beach was extremely windy and almost chilly!!! I'm not sure if it was the time of year or just rough seas during my time there. At times, people had towels over themselves because the breeze was so strong. A rental car is a must unless you intend to stay at the resort all day. You can't walk to anything in the area. Getting a Cab can be near impossible at certain times of the day. That is just the way it is in this area. Another couple told us that they were at the Embassy Suites down the road for dinner 1 evening and they couldn't get a cab. It was 8pm when they tried, so it wasn't even late in the evening. The surrounding area is in transition. A Ritz Carlton Reserve resort and residence is being constructed in the next few years, so the neighborhood is on the rise. Allegedly, If your a guest of this resort, you'll have access to the Ritz's facilities. I'll believe that when I see it. Overall, this is a resort I would come back to as long as I have a car available.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: tbass
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried reading some of the negative reviews, but I realized quickly that most negative reviews are not based on the property, but on the people writing the reviews. You must go into a vacation realizing that you are not going to be the only ones there, there are others that are vacationing as well and we all must share that. That being said, sometimes its better to , as they say, not sweat the small stuff. As mch as we would like, things won't always be perfect. On arrival at the airport, we were greeted by our Dorado Tours shuttle driver John with a placard with our names on it so it was easy to locate. John greeted us and even stopped at the local grocery store on the way to the hotel so that we could stock up. That saved us a trip out later on. John also gave us information on tours that we might like. We took advantage of that and he brought us to Old San Juan and the Bacardi tour. It seemed like John was our own personal driver for the day! He dropped us off at the ferry, made sure we were all set with tickets and gave us times to get back so that he could pick up up(right on time waiting for us) and take us to the Bacardi factory. Once again he got out and set us up with the tours tickets (we could have easily done that), and waited for us to finish the tour. Again, on the way back to the hotel he asked us if we needed to stop anywhere while we were out. He was GREAT! All of the Staff at the hotel were very cordial the entire stay. In my opinion, you only get attitude if you give it! Had a problem with the in room safe, fixed within the hour! Rooms were nice, clean, and very comfortable. The unit had everything we needed. We never had any problems with noisy neighbors (first time in a long time on vaca we didn't have noisy neighbors). Being a home owner I realize that nothing stays brand new forever. Sure, some things need updating, but it never took away from the stay. The closed hotel next door never bothered us either, we were too busy enjoying the beach and the pool to really even notice! The beach was awesome, a little rough and windy, but whatever. Still a great time. Were there some negatives? Sure, but again, we didn't let those little things ruin our stay!! The night shuttle driver Felix, was awesome as well! He recommended places to eat ( he was always right!), got out and made sure we had tables, never made us wait, and also stopped at a store for us. He was great company and an all around nice guys, thanks! La Marena (sp) had great food. The Greenhouse Cafe was awesome as well! Great Ribs! went again just for the ribs, best I have had. The Pika Restaraunt was within walking distance. It was ok, to us, nothing to rave about. We walked that night to Pika, and on the way back at the beginning of the hotel entrance, Felix was driving by and told us to hop in to get a ride back. We would have enjoyed the walk back, but appreciated Felix for offering. My wife and I didn't do much but enjoy a relaxing time at the Hyatt. Thanks everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation--A little lacking for Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: timoray
Reviews.Content: We were here during spring break 2012. The walls are paper thin and the floors are tile which I love be offer no sound barrier. We had noisy neighbors in all directions and there isn't much you can do about it except request an upper floor which is better for ocean views anyway. The reviews about the resort are all accurate: great beach, nice pool, rooms and resort are dated, great fitness facility, great tennis courts, very helpful staff. They will do anything to make your stay as pleasant as possible. We asked for an upgrade from a 1 to a 2 BR unit which they did for $50/night. The sofa bed was terrible and the sofa itself was pretty gross with big stains on the cushions. We thought it was well worth it. We were there a week and I wish we had more time to explore San Juan. It's about 30 - 40 minutes away but I didn't find the traffic all that bad. Perhaps if you are from rural America it would be overwhelming but so would any big US city. We found an outstanding restaurant in San Juan called Juan Enrique's. It was in an interesting area with live music on Saturday night, funky bars and clubs all around and seemed to be quite safe. GO THERE! The food was moderately priced, great atmosphere and great service. We loved Old San Juan and I wish we had another day there. We went to Camuy Caverns and that was a fun day trip. It's not the biggest or best but it's a pleasant drive and about an hour away. We toured the Bacardi Rum distillery and that was pretty fun. There is a lot to do at the resort in the way of activities but we are pretty physical people who love tennis, the beach, working out, etc. If you are a couch potato who doesn't do much physical the resort doesn't have great restaurants or night club entertainment. We would probably go back, not for the resort itself but PR is beautiful with Caribbean culture, good beaches, great restaurants and mostly friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience, visited March 5-10, 2012.”
Reviews.Author: wudwork
Reviews.Content: Pool area is very nice. We did observe some folks putting towel on chair and not returning for hours. I suppose the ultra-private/secluded beach was so much better they stayed there ? The green fence, blocking view of neighboring & closed hotel is NOT an eyesore or any trouble at all. That being closed assured us a VERY large and private beach; just like others have reported here. Our room was on 5th floor so we were higher than the pool area palm trees thus able to clearly see ocean and never ending waves. Very nice! We had great slush drinks at poolside bar. Exercise room is well equipped, yet the elliptical machines seem more home-style than those rated for gym (non-stop) use. The elliptical I used worked fine but clearly would have benefited from a tune-up. They supply wipes to pre, and post, clean your machine. The weight machines were abundant, in good shape, and no lines. Staff was top notch. As others have reported, this place is not physically far from San Juan, but when you add traffic, its a nightmare to try and return to hotel between 4 and 7pm. I truly wish Obama would provide New Jersey the highway funding that somehow Puerto Rico gets.There are orange cones on EVERY roadway and construction guys at all hours of day doing work. About 1 mile outside hotel property is a very large and well stocked grocery store. Its accross street from CVS. The hotel has 2 BBQ propane grills on the beach, so you can easily grill up anything you get at store. The folks around San Juan are truly friendly. While the Policia are EVERYWHERE!!!, we never felt need for them.I asked about getting cigars and I was surprised how many speak english and truly wanted to help me. We got the strong sense that the locals wanted us to be happy. Bottom Line: If trip is to tour San Juan (which I strongly recommend) then this hotel location is not good (again, due to traffic). If trip is to bum around the pool, hands down, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Private and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: omni81
Reviews.Content: The good and the bad. First, the bad: traffic is absolutely horrendous in Puerto Rico, so if you are planning on doing a lot of exploring (like I usually like to do) please be aware that this location is not at all convenient for exploring -- otherwise, if you plan on just sitting on the beach or by the pool, this is a nice option. Also note that there is only one "restaurant" on the property and it closes at 8pm, but it will suit your needs and is probably perfect for kids AND there are great restaurants within a short drive of the resort. The units could use some updating, but they are otherwise clean we thought them to be spacious and just fine. The good: The rooms all have ocean views (above the 4th floor)!!! We had a lovely view on the 7th floor and could see the ocean from our living room/balcony. The beach here is gorgeous and private - we drove around to a few public beaches and it's worth it just to stay here; it was the nicest we found within a 30 min drive. The grounds are gorgeous and the staff is friendly. The property next to the Hyatt is closed but we actually found that this added to the privacy - so it didn't bother us one bit. We would come back again but probably wouldn't stay again for an entire week, only because traffic is so crazy and I would love to see more of the island!

Reviews.Title: “Shame on Hyatt.”
Reviews.Author: leisuresusie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was a Hyatt. We went to our room and all we smelled was mold. The furnishings in the room are old and awful. The restaurant is no better than any fast food restaurant. The only saving grace is the beach. The pools are also good. There is something spooky about the worn green fence that separates the next property. Again about the mold don't go here if you have lung conditions. I used my inhaler more in two days than I have in two years. There are three great employees. The towel guys and the male bartender. The front desk staff were the worst of our three weeks here in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and genually nice people.”
Reviews.Author: jkjkxoxo
Reviews.Content: The waterside in the back of the Olympic swimming pool and the georgeous lazy river and water falls are closed. Also the other side of the hotel and the casino arre closed. Please enjoy climbing on the rocks off the beach

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cape May Court House, New Jersey
Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds & it's beachfront”
Reviews.Author: Mazzahs
Reviews.Content: OK, I loved this place from get-go. My girlfriend & I pulled in while transversing the island & traveling east from Arecibo/Rincon/Isabela. We had one night left before embarking on our last night in Old San Juan. I always wanted to venture into Dorado, so we pulled into town blindly. I aimlessly drove down the road looking for a resort (price was no option since we were tired and wanted a "resort" type place to call home for the night.) We finally found the resort and were stopped at the gate by a guard. He called ahead (a bit surprised at our lack of a reservation), & received the go ahead for our impromptu entrance. The grounds are stellar and vast to say the least. The rate for a studio apt (larger than many studios; this place was built in the 60's-70's I believe) was ideal and much less than the pricier San Juan Metro area. The building iteself is set back a bit from the ocean, but the waves are visible & heard nonetheless. So, I woke from a nap around 7PM prior to out dinner adventure into town & was surprised to see a LARGE section of the property (a separate buliding to the East) from our balcony that was completely DARK. I initially thought that the complex was slow but upon some quick internet research, I realized that this building used to be a part of the hotel (or separate back in the 90's). The building was sinking and included a casino, restaurants, etc. There was also a world famous "lazy pool" that surrounded the hotel that is now fenced off from the remaining 2 Hyatt buildings. I've read and heard conflicting reports that this hotel is being renovated & due for demolition and reconstruction. However, it was an ominous & strange sight since the darkness is ever present being so close to a major resort/hotel. (This would be a great stop for the current cable "ghost" shows to venture into!) It is THAT EERIE.... The rooms are a bit dated, but this in no way detracts from the wonderful amenities & grounds/location. Town center is a mere 5 mins away and the beachfront spot makes up for the semi-dated rooms and abandoned adjacent building. Give this place a shot if you want to venture outside of the SJ Metro area and if you want to experience less traffic & a more authentic PR community.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Del Mar”
Reviews.Author: wisess
Reviews.Content: A bit misleading. The travel guides all said it had a river pool. I guess its the closed down hotel next door that had the river pool. Looks like its been closed a very long time. It was very disappointing. The Hyatt still has a pool, just not very exciting. The hotel itself was otherwise nice and well maintained. Front desk people were fine, though not impressive. Restraunt hours were very limited. Location was good as it gets you out of San Juan but not too far. You will need a rental car if you want to do anything besides the beach and pool on the premises. Not a bad stay but not up to par with other Hyatt's I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Rest and Relaxation with a sprinkle of FUN!”
Reviews.Author: alicialeanna
Reviews.Content: In need of some serious R&R- 3 of us decided on the Hyatt Hacienda Del Mar. We were a bit hesitate after reading the reviews but after a 1 min discussion (yes literally I minute) we realized its Puerto Rico, with tropical weather, next to the ocean what can be bad about that? Most importantly we are in a safe environment and will not have to worry about being isolated at a resort because of precautions. And maybe I am not a 5-star hotel snob like some people *ahem* (I hate to point fingers but I am pointing fingers some of these reviewers). The hotel was fineâ€¦ the rooms were nice- yea there was no flat screen but who needs a tv when you have the beach, and a private beach at that!!! The resort was very accommodating- the pool was nice, the restaurant was not bad either, and I have been to up-to-date hotels where the wireless was much worse. So I say bring a book to the beachâ€¦ again who needs technology when you have a serene atmosphere. The staff was great, answered all questions and was very accommodating. If you stay at this resort make sure you rent a car. The â€œcar serviceâ€� better known as â€œGypsy cabsâ€� are a bit pricey. The money we spent on transportation could have equaled a car plus gas. The restaurants in Dorado are good and I was able to go to the store to stock up on snacks and beverages. The 3 of us are in our twenties and made the BEST time out of our stay. Needless to say I thoroughly enjoyed myself, the Hyatt is a good destination hotel and I would recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time.”
Reviews.Author: carolinagirl50
Reviews.Content: I am a timeshare owner here at the Hyatt and I am happy to report that the area is on it's way back to what it once was. The Ritz Carlton will be one of the hotels that is being built here and will be done by the end of the year. The Cerromar will be coming down when that project is done. The rooms are also in the planning to be renovated. Had a great week the people here are wonderful. I suggest eating at the local restaurants and stay away from the tourist type of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A Peaceful, Quiet Resort with an Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: DarleneMAM
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Puerto Rico on a Continental flight under sunny skies. The pilot dropped the plane like a brick, hit the brakes hard, overcorrected his steering and the plane fishtailed to a stop. Welcome to Puerto Rico! We rented a car to drive to our destination: the Hyatt Vacation Club in Dorado called the Hyatt Hacienda Del Mar. Tooling along the highway from the airport toward old San Juan and beyond to the Hyatt, my husband Mike ambled along as the rest of the world sped by. I noticed the pure decrepitude of many of the vehicles passing us. I saw cars missing front bumpers, back bumpers, and fenders. I saw rust buckets and dent machines. As Mike drove past Old San Juan and on toward Dorado the lanes on the highway were narrow, the construction plentiful and the potholes abundant. My back teeth began to hurt with every impact from every pothole we hit. Those were nothing, though, compared with the mother of all potholes Mike hit on the way into a CVS parking lot. Even my brother-in-law Bid went quiet at the moment of impact; I think his teeth hit his tongue. My sister Cindyâ€˜s butt may even have left her seat. I was sure we had a broken axel at the very least. Mike parked and we all got out of the car and raced to the front of the vehicle to see what weâ€™d broken. Miraculously, nothing was. We laughed and headed toward the storeâ€™s door; we passed a car missing its front bumper, grill, and fenders. We thought our car would look like it by weekâ€™s end. And Iâ€™d need to have my rear fillings replaced. Itâ€™s an easy life at Hyattâ€™s Hacienda Del Mar. With no other resort nearby (and a hotel/casino long closed still stands right next door) the Hyatt is very quiet. We started our first day next to the pool â€“ the pristine, empty pool. We lounged and swam for a while, until our feet started to fry on the concrete apron that surrounds the pool. So we picked up our towels and moved to the beach, mere steps from the pool. Edged in palm trees and with a blue sky above, the ocean cove was breezy and the sand didnâ€™t burn our feet. Every few hours a small raincloud would pass over; sometimes it was hard to tell if it was raining at all â€“ the raindrops were light and warm. We lazed our first day away. Mike and I want to return to the Hacienda Del Mar because it is peaceful and quiet. If you are looking for a fun and lively nightlife, this is not the timeshare resort for you; however, if you are in the mood to chill out and spend meaningful time with your significant other, we highly recommend the resort. We rented a car so we could leave the resort any time we chose; that said, the Hacienda Del Mar does arrange for shuttle services (based on demand) to Old San Juan casinos, the rain forest and other places. A fee is paid directly to the driver. We used a shuttle to go to Old San Juan one evening since parking there is difficult, at best; our driver was chatty, the vehicle well maintained and we got back and forth safely. The rooms at the Hacienda Del Mar, although not brand new, are clean and pleasant; our balcony provided a wonderful view of the cove and ocean beyond. The staff was friendly and kind. If youâ€™d like to see more photos of the resort, please visit my Flickr album: http://www.flickr.com/photos/8164453@N05/sets/72157627781184557/

Reviews.Title: “Need updating!”
Reviews.Author: Bumscoop
Reviews.Content: The beach and view are very nice. The staff helpful. The resort old with one resturant and in a residential area . You have to drive far for a good resturant . Not the best location at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but for a Hyatt lacks alittle”
Reviews.Author: Jody A
Reviews.Content: Expected more for a Hyatt. It is West of San Juan, all the fun stuff - rain forest, bioluminescent kayaking, catamarant excursions, good beaches all are east - so you have to drive thru San Juan with crazy drivers and it can take an hour, it can take 3 hours. The rooms were nice,the kitchen comes equiped with everything you would need for a meal, but the bathrooms could use some updating. Half the games in the "game room" do not work. Only one "restaurant" on site - kitchen is behind the outdoor bar. The closed hotel next door is an eye soar - spooky at night. Did not like the empty pool right next to the fence with standing water in it. The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly. If we ever return to PR - will definately stay east of San Juan!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but hotel needs improvements”
Reviews.Author: Ninjareview
Reviews.Content: Staff is friendly and has a great location on the beach. Rooms need work as bathrooms are really outdated and old. The room we stayed in I'd have a view of the beach. The building next door used to be their casino but now is evacuated since it was sinking. I hope Hyatt renovates the property so it is up to their standards since i am a big hyatt fan. We stayed at st Regis in rio grande (45 min away and near rainforest) a few days later which was a lot nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff; beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: MJchemist
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Hyatt Hacienda Del Mar. We went in November, just before Thanksgiving week, when the weather is pretty good but prices are low and the facility is not crowded. We have stayed here before and will come back. The staff is very friendly and took excellent care of us. One thing that I did not care for - the pillows. The pillows are high, not very soft, and not comfortable for me, but that is a personal preference. The pool was sunny and not crowded. I also saw very few people on the golf course and on the beach. We had a nice ocean view, and I believe that most rooms do.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MattieF
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights. I will say that I had earned some free night certificates from a company I sell for, so we didn't actually have to pay... That said, I wouldn't hesitate to come here. The staff is very pleasant and the beach is quite nice. If I were to nitpick, the rooms are a bit dated with older finishings, television etc, but ours did have a fabulous ocean view! Additionally, self-service laundry facilities were available immediately outside the room. The wifi was a bit slow, but at least that keeps you from spending all your time online! Finally, the closed hotel right next to the Hyatt was a bit depressing. The restaurant is hit or miss. Some items are great and a good deal and some items are dramatically overpriced. The first night I had the burger for $7.95. It was big and the flavor was excellent. My wife had the beefsteak sandwich for a dollar more and it was cold, the beef was tough and it left a strange taste in our mouths for a while after. The next night we had salads, which were very expensive for what they were. $14-16 each for a very average salad. Finally, we ate breakfast before leaving the last day. The food was great, portions were big and the price was good. $8 for 2 eggs, 2 pancakes and sausage. However, coffee was $1.80, refills were $.90 and a can of Sprite was $2.50! Moral of the story, choose carefully and the meal might be worth it. The other thing to keep in mind is the location. Dorado is west of San Juan, so if you are driving anywhere in the South or going to the West via the South, you may have to pass through the traffic hell that is San Juan in both directions. Example: One day we took a trip to El Yunque to go hiking. Leaving at about 12:30pm It took us around an hour and a half to get there, even with a short stop o eat and stroll through an outlet mall. On the way home (left the forest at 6pm) it took us over 2 hours, including sitting on 22E in what resembled a parking lot more than a highway. Of course that's driving in PR I suppose! All in all, I really enjoyed the visit at the Hyatt and would recommend it if you were headed to Dorado.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: bczgrl
Reviews.Content: I am an owner at Hacienda Del Mar but had not been back in at least 4 years. As the previous reviewer stated it was disappointing to see the river pool and restaurants at the old Cerromar closed but it did not impact the wonderful time I enjoyed. Check in was effortless and the front desk staff very accomodating in giving me a top floor room with a direct view of the ocean. The 2 bedroom unit was very clean and well appointed. I did not notice a "musty" smell at all. In the off season the restaurant hours are somewhat limited (No breakfast) but the Market has everything you need to whip up breakfast. Another change is to the town of Dorado itself. You can now find a Starbucks, Applebees and Popeyes just 10 minutes down the road. If you want local cuisine the restaurants mentioned by other reviewers are great. If you don't feel like driving, the hotel arranges for a nominal fee, outings a couple of evenings a week to the casinos and restaurants in San Juan. The beach is beautiful, the staff is warm and accomodating. I will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: jwaldvo773
Reviews.Content: We are owners at Hacienda Del Mar but have not been back for 6 years. We came to "scout things out" for our annual family vacation. There was some concern because of the negative reviews. It is sad to see the big green fence and the absence of the river pool, slides, grottos, etc. but we had a wonderful time. The beach is as beautiful as ever. The rooms are clean, comfortable and adequately furnished. The staff is lovely and accomdating. There are several delightful restaurauts very close by and we had wonderfully presented meals at Pika and The Greenhouse. Would we come back? Can't wait

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Shanna W
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Puerto Rico and stayed at the Hyatt Hacienda Del Mar with a group of 4 girls in our 20s. I was nervous at first because of all the bad reviews I had read. We ended up arriving late at night because we missed our flight, and then lost our luggage on top of that. The staff was so nice, they checked us in quickly and kept us updated on the status of our luggage. The room was nice, didn't see any roaches or other bugs, as previous reviews stated. Pool is warm and clean, beach is beautiful and private. I would stay here again. Although there isn't much to do around the hotel, we used the tour service listed on the hotel website for our transportation. Our drivers names were Sigfredo and Mercie. They were AMAZING!! Sigfredo took us all over Puerto Rico showing us the sites, taking us to local restaurants and he even set up and booked all our excursions for us. I would highly recommend using him and if I ever get the chance to go back, I will call him again. Our trip would not have been what it was if it weren't for him and Mercie!

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: Rekon
Reviews.Content: I traded a timeshare for the week that I stayed at the Hyatt in Dorado Puerto Rico. In order to enjoy the area you must have a car. I had a one bedroom unit to trade-in, instead I got a lockoff two bedroom unit which it was a nice touch because we traveled with a couple and this added the extra privacy and convenience for all parties involved. The main unit had a complete kitchen, living room with a sofabed. LCD screen TV, laser disc and stereo for music. Kitchen was equipped with plently of cooking utensils. There was a toaster, coffee maker, range, microwave, and dishwasher. soap for the dishwasher was supplied at no extra charge. There was also a washer and a dryer in the unit. The view from the unit was jaw-dropping, beautiful and breathtaking. We were not charge for electricity (like or resorts do), or for using their amenities which included 24 hour swimming pools and gym. The beach was beautiful and within a few steps from the swimming pools. My time share trade-in was valued at 530 dollars for my maintance fees and another 140.00 for the exchange fees for the grand total of 670 dollars. At 670 dollars for one week is comes out to 95.00 a day which is in my opinion a steal. Remenber to go to the lobby every morning before 10:00 a.m. fresh coffee, capuchino, and chocolate free of charge. Will be back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Virgfig
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 day stay at the Hyatt Hacienda Del Mar. We traded our timeshare through Interval International. From reading some of the previous reviews, I was a little worried. But I have to say the hotel was great and the staff was wonderful. We arrived four hours prior to check in. The staff kept our luggage locked up while we had lunch on their property. Within an hour, they notified us our room was ready. The room was located on the eighth floor and we had a beautiful view of the ocean. The furniture was a bit outdated but that is the only negitive thing we experienced. The kitchen had all the amenities you needed if you wanted to do any cooking. We asked for a late checkout and they compromised and allowed us to stay an extra hour which was really helpful. The staff was wonderful and very accomodating to all our needs. If we ever travel back to Puerto Rico, we will return. The vacant property next door did not bother us at all! The pool and grounds were spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Geri168
Reviews.Content: We were at the Hyatt from Aug 13 to 20, 2011. This is our third stay at this hotel. We rented a two bedroom for my husband, my 2 sons (20 & 15) , my nephew (16) and me. We all had a really good time. Beach and pool during the day and relaxing nights in the game room or in the hot tub. Since we were there with 2 other families we had alot of fun :) We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nightmare”
Reviews.Author: memory1976
Reviews.Content: It was a horrible experience staying there. we slept with the lights on we were afraid of the cockroaches. Very dirty room. disgusting!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. Never again!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We were overcharged at the Bohio Grill and overstayed our welcome”
Reviews.Author: XXTRISHXX
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel several times in the past year, so much so that the staff knew us by name. It is a FABULOUS hotel, the grounds are great, the 24 hour pool is great. But this last stay was horrible! The Bohio grill overcharged us for the wings, then after signing the bill and charging it to the room the man added on a 20% tip AFTER THE BILL WAS CLOSED!!! I had to spend two days fighting for my $3.08 back, I know it sounds like a small amount considering we spent almost $200.00 for the one bedroom rental, but it was the fact that it was taken from us and was done sneaky! This was one bill of hot wings that we were overcharged for, so I can only imagine if we ate there frequently how much they would have overcharged us! Then when I showed the manager that I was overcharged she told me, "It's only three dollars, I will give it to you out of my pocket", but she never did, I had to continue to fight for it. We rented the one bedroom because it states that it comes with a whirlpool tub and spacious closets...when we arrived there was NO tub, and the closet was one foot wide, we couldn't unpack because there was no place to hang our clothes, we requested a room change but the manager said they were totally booked, although there was only 12 people or less in the pool and about six on the beach, there is no way it was booked! The manager told me she would have a room ready for us in the morning, I called at noon and the room wasn't ready, I went down and waited at her desk at 3pm and she told me it would be ready in five minutes, I waited over an hour for it to be ready and she kept telling me five minutes, I then waited upstairs in the room and after 25 minutes she called to say it was available, so I wasted one and a half days at the front desk trying to get the three dollars refunded to me, and I wasted a day in a room that was not what we paid for, and another half a day was wasted waiting for the room we paid for to be ready for us! Total waste! The other reason I rated this low is because I am a stickler for safety, the security guard was sleeping on several occasions. I have always rated this hotel as a five in the past, but it seems like the more we stayed there the more they resented us and gave us bad service and bad rooms. In the first room we stayed the shower made a horrible noise and shook the walls, by chance I ran into the repairman and he was very polite, he asked me if everything was working in the room, I told him the shower sounds like a jackhammer and he told me, "I will fix it, go to the manager and change rooms", this was on the first day we were there, so even he knew there where rooms available!!! I really feel that we overstayed our welcome and the staff became resentful and that is why they gave us such a horrible room and not the room we paid for! I HATE being lied to!!! And I know I was lied to about it being totally booked! If you do stay there, the grounds are awesome, very relaxing! Just keep an eye on the charges you make to the BOHIO GRILL, and pay cash so they don't write in an extra amount at the end!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: Tallmans
Reviews.Content: We REALLY ENJOYED OUR TIME!! The one thing we missed was Flamenco Beach! Our favorite restaurant was Pika Bar and restaurant very near the Hyatt. Great food and Friday night music! Get to know Maria and Nestor the owners! Great people!!

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Puerto Rico "a trailor park of a hotel:”
Reviews.Author: DRuben1330
Reviews.Content: Hyatt continues to dimishish its othertwise "great" reputation with any association with this old, outdated,property. YOU MUST AVOID THIS ONE!! The only thing that is missing is the shag carpet from 1970. Its truly a dump, on every level. Purto Rico is not a destination vacation area, and we are only passing through town to catch a cruise ship. If you must stay in Puerto Rico, by all means stay at the Ritz and PLEASE avoid this property.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure to return!”
Reviews.Author: needbettermattress
Reviews.Content: We hadn't bothered to review the property since our stay, however we find the recent reviews quite unfair. It's true that the abandoned property by the Hyatt is unsightly, if your focused on that while your on vacation- in this very relaxing property. It doesn't take away from the view. As always the staff was great, very accommodating. We've stayed at the Hyatt a few times times in the last couple of years, we've had different 2 bedroom apartments- NOT ONCE have we had a smelly room or noticed a stench anywhere on the property. The room was clean as always, well stocked too. The beach, can be rough certain times of the year, but for the most part its a great beach. There are always activities coordinated for the guests and many things to do with the family while on retreat. We look forward to our next stay :-)

Reviews.Title: “Extremely dissapointed - HYATT why are you not keeping the property up to your standards??”
Reviews.Author: CRHALLEN
Reviews.Content: Rooms: curtains looked like Swiss cheese, dishes had caked on food residue and lipstick on cups, coffee pot grimey, tub drain broken, floors filthy, room smelled so bad had to buy a plug in room deoderizer, bed extremely uncomfortable, rooms outdated and not as pictured told hotel was out of blankets when asked for additional blanket for fold out bed. Staff: RUDE!!! DEFINATELY NOT HYATT STANDARD OF SERVICE. Shockinlgy unprofessional. The only personable/helpful staff members were Liz the concierge and Hector. Actually go out of their way to not help you. Won't make eye contact for fear of being asked to assist you in some way. Restaurant on property: NO NO NO!!! Don't bother. COOK IN YOUR ROOM! Rudest waitress - think she was the owner's daughter. Food was WAY OVER PRICED and drinks were weak. Grounds: The front looks like a country club well past its prime. The abondoned building is haunting it is so dilapidated. Abandoned guard shacks are an eye sore. Trash on the grounds. The pool is nice and beach is nice for PR. The water in the cove is beautiful. Surf is strong in the middle of the cove. Swimming is only acceptible on the right edge. The sand fleas are terrible at dusk and the locals crash the beach. The abandoned building and moldy lazy river mar the view from the balcony from the top floors. The view on the bottom floors is non-existant as the trees are in the way. Dorado: Unsafe feeling at night. Some places have to buzz you in to enter - Baskin Robbins for one. The locals for the most part are unfriendly and too proud to prioritize customer service. Plan to have meals in your room. There is a large grocery in town. Avoid the Amigo - no selection and unsafe. PR: Getting around is almost impossible to do on your own. For the most part no street signs and if you ask directions no one speaks English. Do not eat fast food. DO NOT go to the public beaches. PACK YOUR LUNCHES or patronize the high end restaurants. Do not believe the Frommer's guide. Not related to the hotel but a note I thought I should make: CULEBRA: Do NOT try to take the ferry as suggested by the HYATT concierge. Not going to happen - I do not care if you sleep in line. Book a boat tour (we used East Island Excursions). Flaminco Beach - A MUST SEE. Had an amazing snorkling experience. HYATT: What is going on at this property? If this is some sort of co-effort on your part it is not working out in your favor. NOT what I expect from a HYATT property. Not up to your standards and well below par for a Hyatt Vacation Club option. You should be ashamed of yourselves.

Reviews.Title: “The stench is overwhelming”
Reviews.Author: Laurcus
Reviews.Content: I could not be more grossed out by a hotel than this one. The smell is unbearable... I can't even fall asleep because the stench is so bad and it makes me physically nauseated to inhale. Id prefer motel 6. I cannot express in words the terrible stench here.

Reviews.Title: “Old and outdated but great beach”
Reviews.Author: hannahneal88
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I went on our honeymoon to Puerto Rico. His grandparents traded a week through their timeshare. We did not have an option of where to go so we were just glad to have a free honeymoon. I had read reviews on here and seen pictures so I was not completely surprised by how outdated the place was. The room was very musty and stayed that way throughout our stay. VERY outdated and very uncomfortable sleeping. We wore our shoes the whole time we were in the room because the floor felt gross. Everything in the room (we stayed in a studio) was outdated and not appealing. We were on the top floor so we had an amazing view of the ocean, not everyone was as lucky because there are a lot of trees blocking the view for the lower rooms. We were not bothered by the abandoned building next door - there are so many trees you can barely tell it is there. The beach was great and very relaxing. Completely private and in a nice cove. We could see our feet in the water and the temperature was great! We always had lounge chairs available to us and did not have to get out to the beach super early to get them. There were ALOT of families there which I was surprised by. It seemed like a lot of them were from the Puerto Rico surrounding areas. The pool was very busy during the day full of young families. We stuck to the beach except at night we would occasionally swim. The "tiki" bar on site has pretty decent food but gave me very bad heartburn every time I ate there (lots of fried food). We ventured out a little but not much because we did not feel comfortable renting a car just the two of us. We had John (Monty) take us to the places we wanted to go. He runs a tour and cab service in the lobby and was AMAZING. We arranged to have him pick us up at the airport when we got there and he took us to the grocery to get some basic items before taking us to the hotel. We HIGHLY recommend using him to get you places. We ate at The Greenhouse Cafe and Pika (same people who own the "tiki" bar at the Hyatt). We had great food at both. We went to the casino nearby that is part of another hotel and it was nice and new, but very small. Overall it was very relaxing on the beach but the room just kind of ruined it along with the heartburn from the tiki bar. I would not recommend this for a honeymoon if you are looking for luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot. Would go back”
Reviews.Author: MEG52673
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a quiet, uncrowded place to enjoy the weather and relax during spring break. We found it at the Hyatt Hacienda. Our 2 bedroom condo was very comfortable and suited our needs very well. We found excellent restaurants in the area and convenient grocery stores to supply us for breakfast and lunch. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views but lots of issues....”
Reviews.Author: RF2009
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently visited Puerto Rico for the first time and stayed at the Hyatt Hacienda Del Mar. On first view, we were favorably impressed with this ocean front property and general facities. However, it was soon evident that this property has not been maintained up to Hyatt's normal standards and that the adjoining hotel, casino and shared amenities (water slide) have been closed for several years. On closer inspection, the lobby and guest rooms are in need of serious updating; ranging from a fresh coat of paint to new mattress and bedding, to a serious overhaul of the air conditioning. More specifically, our room and bathroom could have benefited from a serious, in-depth cleaning. We learned that the adjoining properties have been acquired by a new developer and will be demolished and then rebuilt over the next few years. We were also informed that the Hyatt intends to update the Hacienda Del Mar in conjunction with the redevelopment of the adjoining properties. From our perspective, the demolition and construction of a new hotel and casino will be extremely noisy and not a very restful environment for a vacation. I doubt my wife and I will return to the Hacienda Del Mar in the foreseeable future.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!”
Reviews.Author: KJMB
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE!!! DO NOT WASTE YOUR TRADE WITH THIS PLACE! Check in is at 4:00! The front desk would not let me check in until 5:00 PM, repeatedly saying the room is being cleaned....then move me to another room??? NOPE, they refused saying that only certain rooms are available for people who exchange into hyatt. OMG...then at check out they are banging on your door BEFORE 10AM when check out is at 10am....DO NOT I REPEAT DO NOT WASTE YOUR WEEK ON THIS PLACE! the inside of the unit is so outdated, from the 70's...worn out old! the kitchen has fake cabinet fronts that do not open, and again are all worn out....the shower is tiny and has a dirty old curtain on it. and worn out old uncleanable grout/tile....the metal shelf in the shower is all tarnished and old....IT IS JUST AN OLD OLD OUTDATED PLACE....I FEEL SO SORRY FOR THE OWNERS OF HERE! THE ENTIRE PLACE NEEDS TO BE GUTTED AND REDONE! IT DEFINATELY HAS POTENTIAL BUT DOES NOT MEET UP TO HYATT STANDARDS!!!!! beds are old and lumpy, pillows are flat.....you can not see the ocean from your balcony as there are too many palm trees blocking the view!!! Bottom line, It is just tooo tooo OLD and outdated !

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing trip & good place if you have very young children”
Reviews.Author: Jya-Jya
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my Mom & 3 kids. My first child turned 4 when we were there and my twins were less than 9 months. Totting 3 small kids, I wanted a place with a kitchen & location on the beach so we would never have to leave the resort. This place had both and I was surprised by the size of the kiddie pool. They also have daily activities for young kids, like coloring contest, painting, family bingo, arts & crafts, etc. Before we arrived at the hotel we had the driver stop at the grocery store. I picked up bread & cold cuts, chicken wings, bagels & cream cheese, cereal, milk, salad, etc and a birthday cake & balloons for the birthday party. My mom ate at the resort restaurant once, but I never had to eat out! I did have some drinks though. They gave us 2 cribs and 2 high chairs for our stay which was also great! Our trip was easy & very relaxing. The only negative things were that the place did feel icky. I never mentioned the reviews to my mom about the place not feeling clean and she brought it up on her own. She said it's not cleaned well and had a mildew feeling/smell. One day the floor felt so yucky I couldn't even bare to take my shoes off. If any staff or owners read this I would like to suggest airing the place out and cleaning w/ bleach, ammonia, lysol etc after each stay. Also replacing the dark comforters with airy fluffy white ones will give it a more clean feel. Maybe doing the same for the curtains too! Of course it would be awesome if the bathrooms were updated too, but I understand this is not a luxury hotel so I can deal with it. Overall very relaxing trip and good for families. I don't think I'd come here if it was just me & my spouse or if our children were older (like preteen/teenage), but it met all my current needs and I would consider coming back.

Reviews.Title: “It was beautiful!!!”
Reviews.Author: galop1979
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I took our mother's for the week from 4/30 until 5/7/11. The beach was beautiful as well as the pool area. I enjoyed the gym and hot tub as well. The staff was excellent and very polite. Housekeeping needs some fine tuning as the floor felt dirty to me as well. Nonetheless we would stay there again because it was so peaceful and relaxing. The abandon building next door did not bother us at all. It gave us more beach area and more privacy to walk with my spouse. Down fall was that there was no night life in the area but again I say it was nice for relaxing with a drink. I definitely recommend this for those seeking a peaceful relaxing vacation by the pool or drinks. There was no time frame to use the pool since I did it almost every night until late. We enjoyed ourselves very much in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “STILL A LOVELY GETAWAY FROM WINTER'S WRATH”
Reviews.Author: bklynbiker
Reviews.Content: Happy to see more recent reviews are better for the Hacienda, which means people must be reading the reviews and can tell whether the property is for them or not. We love our annual or biannual visits. Four nights/five days of lazing on the beach, swimming, reading, cooking and imbibing, watching DVDs at night, and listening to surf from our balcony or bedroom overnight. What more could one want? Oh, you mean blaring discos, drunken poolside parties and roving bands of youths traipsing through the lobby? If that's your holiday, go for it, but please stay elsewhere, you won't like it here. Just a pristine, uncrowded beach, lovely well kept grounds, gracious staff, very comfortable units (do yourself a favor if you're planning to spend most of your time at the resort, GO FOR the one bedroom, NOT the studio units, it's worth the upgrade in terms of $ or points) - and never NEVER had an issue with 'cleanliness' as some , not -quite so recent reviews have stated. And we've been here 1/2 a dozen times over the years.

Reviews.Title: “definitely Paradise ohh yeahhh”
Reviews.Author: bubu42
Reviews.Content: OMG it is one of the most quiet and beautiful places I have stayed at. We didnt even realize there was a building next door. Girls at the front desk 10+ very helpful, Divina and Nancy are amazing thanks for your charisma. Pool open 24 hours,beach uffff adorable. Plenty of restaurants nearby, Morena,The Greenhouse and Grappa the best ever. The kids had so much fun, the hotel offers daily activities for them,and they also enjoyed the miniature golf. We will definitely go back to the hotel oh yes.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: kdgSt_Louis
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hyatt through an exchange with Interval International. I was a little nervous reading some of the reviews, especially since we had traded our very nice 5-star resort in Cancun. We ended up being very pleased with the resort. The resort is nice, especially the pool and beach. The abandon hotel next door is very strange, but didn't really bother us. The beach was fantastic and since the hotel next door was closed, we had plenty of space and never felt crowded. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The tennis courts and basketball court were also nice. We thought the food was good at the hotel restaurant and tried the newer Pike restaurant across the street, which was also good. Probably our biggest complaint was the housekeeping. The rooms were nice, but not well cleaned. The floors felt dirty, even after the one day of the week it was cleaned. I don't think the floors were mopped and we felt like we had to walk around with shoes on. Otherwise, we felt like the hotel was nice and clean outside of the rooms. We would definitely go back to this resort. It is not a luxury resort, but it is nice. The area, however, does not have really anything to do. There was really no shopping outside of discount and grocery stores. We had a our 12 year old and our 10 year old niece, which was fine for them. Older children and those wanting a night life would be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful lazy kick-back and read a book comfy stay”
Reviews.Author: Patrickbeau
Reviews.Content: Staff was wonderful. The rooms were very clean and our view was fantastic. We met a lot of wonderful people and will go back again next February. There was never a time when we could not get a place by the pool or on the beach. Not crowded and the pool was wonderful. It was a great place to go and chill. If you want to have the freedom to travel about, just rent a car for the duration of your stay and enjoy. We got a Target rental for $219 total for two weeks. Plenty of places to eat in the area. Wish we were back there now.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: mjmccormick41
Reviews.Content: Like other reviews said, if you want a place to sit by the pool or beach, this is your place. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Never had to worry about saving a chair by pool or water. The day we left only 6 other people at beach. I would rent a car. best way to get around, we went to Old San Juan 3 times, wifes shopped, we exployred ,loved the culture , yes food is expensive, but wonderful, the 2 forts are a must see. Just wonder down the old cobble stone streets is a step back in time. Lots of great restranunts, shopping. See the Bacardi Rum Factory, had many free samples. Parked once in Cantoe, and took ferry, fifty cents oneway, ferry runs on island time. dont be in a hurry, . Yes the Del Mar is a little outdated, and the old hotel next door is an eyesord, but after a few days , you dont even notice it. Hate to admit it but did eat at Chilis in Dorado, new nice place. Went to outlet mall one rainy morning. very new , about 30 miles west on 22, some good places to eat, try Metropol. Would go back again to Dorado, looks like a great place to golf.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: kayway11
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time. We are Marriott timeshare owners. Do not pay attention to those awful reviews. We were on the 5th floor in a one br condo. Clean as a pin..great view..quiet...no negatives from us... the closed hotel next door is absolutely not an issue. The beach is indescribable, the personnel are very nice competent and friendly. There are plenty of stores within less than a 10 min drive. Amigos is Walmart and very reasonable for groceries. On site restaurant great, the pool is immaculate. The facility was full and you would never know it. The beach was as great as Hawaii....do not pay attention to any bad reviews..it is a great place to spend a winter vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to spend a week”
Reviews.Author: pcr01
Reviews.Content: Spent 9 days there in January. I continues to be a wonderful place to vacation. I go with my wife, three daughters, son in law and granddaughter. We had a wonderful time. I own there and go every year. Ivan the GM is a great guy and is always around looking to make things better. The young ladies at the desk are first class, they are friendly, they care and give great sevice. We found a great resteraunt in Dorado, Grappa is the name, it is great. There is a meat store, Hacienda behind Walgreens that sells great meats. They ;have gas grills that are great to use. The Beach is great and the pool is nice. Tje [;ace is not luxerious it is just nice. Can't wait to go back.. If you go and play golf, look for my golf balls, I lost a lot of them..

Reviews.Title: “Had a wondeful time”
Reviews.Author: carolinagirl50
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt timeshare is definately coming back and we had a great time. Everyone treated us wonderful. The area is being rebuilt and things are no longer in limbo land. The beach was great. There is a nice little open air restaurant on the beach where you can get 3 meals a day. I own there and I'm going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, not a great area”
Reviews.Author: elroy74
Reviews.Content: First, the vacant hotel next door is a little weird. It does not take away from the stay, but it is just strange to see the property sitting vacant. I spoke with someone involved with the property that said Fairmont Hotel has signed a contract to manage a new hotel there, but the are tearing down the old one once financing is in place. This is still a long way off. ROOMS: Now, the rooms at the hotel were very nice. We stayed on the 7th floor and had a full two bedroom. Nice rooms, very clean, and great kitchen/dining space. The balconies were great, and faced the pool area/ocean. The kitchen could use a little more in the way of plates and utensils, but overall, it was pretty good. The housekeeping came once during the week on Tuesday. You are able to request clean towels, but this is a time share/rental property and not a hotel. We requested a crib, high chair and extra pillows, and all requests were met. The staff at the front desk did a nice job trynig to help us with any requests. POOL/BEACH: The pool was nice, but it is not heated. This was a little issue for the kiddie pool, as it was very cold the first two days. The staff did an average job is cleaning out the pools. One morning the kiddie pool was closed for cleaning. I only question the timing of this, as if it had been done earlier, it would have not cut into the morning as much as it did. There is only one towel station, and it is next to the beach. You need to give a room number and they write a ticket for the towels you take. THere is a $25 charge if you do not return the towel. Make sure to get your ticket back! You can also get a towel at the front desk, but only when the towel shack is not open. Not the best set-up. FOOD: There is one resturant on property. It is a small beach/poolside bar/resturant. The food was fine, basic and easy. My one MAJOR issue was the birds. There was bird poop all over the chairs. It was kind of gross. One night the woman working there told us we were not allowed to take food to go. We mentioned to the staff at the desk and they said they would address. The propert also has two gas grills you can reserve. We cooked steak one night. You have to reserve yout time at the front desk, and they give you the grilling tools. There are two grocery stores near the resort. One is in Dorado Central, called Supermax or something. The other is much closer, near a resturant called the Chop House. We only found the second one on the last day. It is closer to the resort, and everyone there spoke english. The Supermax was more of a drive through a busy area. The staff sent us to a couple of resturants. Villa De Alberto was good, but a little pricey. Sweet Ann's Cakes was a very good lunch spot. We also ate the the Chop House, which is a Hibachi style Asian resturant. There is a lot more variety in San Juan, but that is a bit of a trip. All in all we had a very good time at the resort. We even received a discount on golf at the Dorado Beach Resort as Hyatt guests. The biggest issue was the area around the Hyatt. It has a lot of fast food, and not a lot to do. If you are going to stay in, cook, and relax by the pool/beach, it is perfect. If you are looking for nice dinners, and night life, this is not really the spot. I do not hold this against the hotel, because it is not what we wanted. We were very happy with our trip. Would I go back? Not sure. May try something a little closer to San Juan if we head back down.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet, lovely place”
Reviews.Author: dwaxy
Reviews.Content: I just got back from the Hyatt with my wife, four children (ranging between 7 and 14 years old) and mother. I almost feel compelled to write to respond to the last negative review. We all had a terrific time. The rooms were spacious and clean (no mold). The units come with a full ktichen including a full sized fridge. We took full advanatge and ate most of our meals in the dining area. The pool area was lovely and never overrun by people. There were always plenty of towels available. My kids loved the hottubs and used them frequently. The hotel has its own private beach which was similarly lovely. The sand was soft and clean. There were never too many people on the beach and we never felt crowded. The water was clear and not too cold. The tennis courts were in perfect shape. We play tennis regularly back home and had no issue whatosever with the courts. We played night tennis as the courts have lights and stay open late. The closed hotel next door was not an eyesore and posed no problems. Dorado is an attractive area about 35-45 minutes from San Juan. It has plenty of shops and a fully stocked supermarket. Overall, if you are looking for a quiet, fully furnished place to stay away from the hustle and bustle of San Juan, I highly recommend the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “FORGOTTEN by the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: acrossthepond7
Reviews.Content: Where to start!! I have never written a review, but my experience was so bad, I felt compelled to alert other travelers of this hotel. I read all the reviews that I could before we headed to Dorado's Hyatt Hacienda Del Mar. This is also a TimeShare location for Marriott and other hotel chains. We go on big family trip through my parent's Time Share, so we don't get to choose the location or hotel. This was the MOST disappointing experience we have ever had. All those reviews that have a negative tone are RIGHT!! I have never been to a Time Share location that is in such poor condition. It looks FORGOTTEN and almost ABANDONED. No wonder all the hotel pictures on the website are taken at NIGHT!! Driving into the location, it looks completely under maintained. It was definitely the place to be, back in the day, but now it looks completely neglected and rundown. We all joked that is was like something out of the show LOST. There was this creepy presence of the deserted hotel next door that used to share the grounds and pools together. Now there is a big green fence separating the two. The amazing pools and giant water slide looked great, but now over grown and deserted it supplies a very eerie presence. FOOD: There was only one outdoor bar eatery, that was it. Had to rent a car to get groceries or eat out 99% of the time. Cabbing it was way TOO EXPENSIVE. ROOMS: are outdated, dirty, musty and moldy. We have small children (2 yrs, 4yrs.). We were horrified at the dust, mold, etc. It really made my skin crawl. Everyone (all 4 of us) developed a respiratory cough from the moldy A/C in our room. Had to sleep without any air to get some relief. There were holes in sheets and blankets. Not enough staff to clearly maintain hotel properly. AMENITIES: lounging and tableware is totally beat up and old looking. Pools were dirty and not cleaned, until some staff member threw in a ridiculous amount of chlorine in the morning, making the pool very cloudy and personally unusable. Jacuzzis were luke warm and the other one was broken the entire trip. The kids playground had been demolished from a storm and sat in a heap off to the side of the volleyball court with caution tape around it. They started to put it together the day before we left. There are no activities or kids club at the hotel. Tennis courts and mini- golf haven't been touched in years. The paint is chipping off of everything, it's really depressing looking. Staff is generally nice and lucky to have a job once the other hotel closed, so you feel bad. They mean well, but it should not be classified as a 4 star luxury resort. All the guests were very upset and mad about what was promised and what was delivered. A guest got her iphone stolen next to the hotel coffee machine at 7:30am after working out in the small hotel gym. This hotel has been acquired by a private company and it should not be considered a HYATT. It is at best 2 stars. IT seems to be the place to go if you are from Puerto Rico. At the end of our vacation. There were tons of locals checking in. Bringing all their laundry, bringing coolers to the pool, bringing there own radios to blast poolside. I did NOT feel like I was at a luxury resort, like it is advertised. It really ruined our trip and caused a great deal of stress. Positives: We had great weather (thank god), the beach is really nice. that's it! We would NEVER return to this Hotel. It was FALSE Advertising! Time Share Interval Award Winner 2010 displayed at the front desk made us all laugh, what a joke. Dorado the city is definitely on the upswing though. Beautiful beaches! They are tearing down old hotels and putting up beautiful condos, championship golf courses, a Ritz Time Share, more eateries, etc. Maybe a place to visit in a few years, once they have it together, but not at that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Beach! Great place to relax. Everything you need is a cab ride away.”
Reviews.Author: Dre35
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice in the past year. This is a great place if you want a relaxing vacation (which is exactly what I was looking for). Many reviews talk about this place being secluded. I wouldn't describe it that way. However, you should know what this place is and what it is not. It is not near any thriving commercial areas. If you want to walk to a fantastic restaurant , you cannot. If you want to party all night and walk back to your hotel, this is not the place. All of those things can be had, but they are a cab ride away. First, the little bar/restaurant on the property can serve you food and drinks. The management of this little tiki bar has changed in the past year. I thought it was fantastic food with fantastic service PRIOR to the change. Now, the product and the service are decidedly subpar. But for a beer or 12, they do a good job. There is a restaurant and pub across the street which serves good food and drinks (run by the same people as the little tiki bar, but much better food and service, ironically). If you take a $10 cab ride into Dorado (about 5 minutes), you can choose from the restaurants and bars there. You must visit the Chophouse! Great food and great people that run the place. There are a couple of bars that are great fun on the weekends, but dead during the week (We watched Monday night football there and were literally the only people there). For more than that, you have to travel into San Juan, which is a $60 and 45 minute cab ride (one way). If you can, stay in San Juan for a night or two upon arrival or prior to leaving. That will allow you to do everything you want there without taking time during your stay in Dorado. This cabbing around might be a problem if it weren't for the cab drivers they have on call here. You can plan your day with these guys and they will be where they say they'll just show up wherever you are whenever you planned it. They are fantastic! (that ones for you, Felix!) I should also mention that the hotel staff has provided me with fantastic, above-the-call-of-duty type of service. If you need anything at all, they can--and will--help. Lastly, some reviewers are critical of the rooms. Yes, I too have stayed at many Hyatts across the country, and this was probably the lowest quality room of them all. However, I have also stayed at alot of limited service places around the country, and this is on par with the best of those. The beds are comfortable, the water is hot. And, oh yeah, its in a tropical paradise, so i'll happily take this over the Hyatt Regency in Minneapolis any day of February. All things considered, I think this is a great place to have a relaxing vacation, with all the dining/dancing/partying you want an arms length away. And by the way, the beach here is one of the best you will stumble upon in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: travelorWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for for 5 nights with 7 total (3 kids and 4 adults) in a 2 BR 2 Bath suite that sleeps eight. Rooms were clean and the $189/ night rate was a bargain. Pool area was a lot of fun, well maintained and clean. Great beach with huge wave action. The resort is a bit removed from the town, so you'll need transportation to leave the resort. We have family in Dorado so that was not a problem for us. We needed the extra sleeping capacity for overflow. Our other 2 grandchildren joined us to partake in the fun during the daytime. The old Cerromar complex next door is closed and in the process of being transformed or torn down. We really didn't notice much because of the palm trees and fencing separating the two properties.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL!!! 2nd Floor Studio”
Reviews.Author: XXTRISHXX
Reviews.Content: I have been trying to submit my review for some time now...every time I upload the photo's it times out on me. It will not let me add any of my photos of the room, the beach or the grounds, I have tons of photos but it will only let me add one of the beach...sorry! My husband and I live in Puerto Rico and are constantly going on weekend getaways. This hotel is by far the BEST we have ever stayed in! We booked online and saved money as opposed to calling in and booking. We booked a studio and was given the 2nd floor. The view was obstructed with palm trees, but that only added to the peaceful and relaxing time we had, we could see the ocean through the trees, and it was pure bliss. The best part was the 24 hour pool and jacuzzi access, and the 24 hour beach access. It was as if we had the entire pool and beach to ourselves! The staff was amazing, friendly and very warm and welcoming, very eager to answer any questions we had. Shani (spelling) was amazing and went out of her way to make sure all my questions were answered, she was very friendly and always welcomed me with a smile and a "Good Morning". We were leery on staying here after reading some of the reviews about it smelling musty/moldy, but we are so happy that we decided to try it out for ourselves. We were very happy to see that the entire hotel was well maintained, clean and quiet. This weekend was pure rest and relaxation and we loved it so much we decided to go back the following week (another review to follow with photos). This hotel is not good if you are looking for the party nightlife, it is in Dorado and there is not much to do outside the hotel at night. There are some places to go that are close by, there is Applebees restaurant, Starbucks, Sweet Anne Cakes, Wendy's, CVS, Walgreens, Pizza Hut, and a supermarket, as well as some other small stores. The hotel had three tennis courts and a golf course, but we were too busy relaxing to check them out. The also had a spa, but once again, we were too relaxed to use it, (maybe next time). If you are looking for a nice and relaxing, quiet, romantic and peaceful vacation, then this hotel is for you! I would highly suggest this hotel, it has all that and then some! But if you are looking for the partying nightlife, loud and obnoxious style of nights, then do not stay here you will be disappointed! This hotel is for the family who wants to discover Puerto Rico and have a wonderful and peaceful vacation! This hotel is very "kid friendly" although we don't have children, we did notice some families having a wonderful time. The pool is open 24 hours and is large enough to have your own "private section" during the day. At night we enjoyed the entire pool all to ourselves! The only downside was the parking, but we always managed to find a spot not too far from the front doors. The parking is free and well lite, security is constantly making their rounds, but not overbearing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: traveler_with_babies
Reviews.Content: Here goes, the latest on this hotel. Dorado is about 40 min. drive from San Juan. I would advice for most of you guys to rent a car. It's very easy to drive and there are so many diff. places to see. To go to El Yunque/ Luquillo, or to the coffee town (ponce) or to Guayate (rosted pig street), you'll have to drive from Dorado into San Juan and take express way (I wouldn't use regular road because of the traffic) that would then route to other cities. That add about 30 min to your time. Make sure you have have enough coins/ cash for tollways. The hotel was kind of hard to find even using GPS. We find the room was clean and the kitchen was well equiped. The hotel is old but not too old. The rooms are clean and the view was great. We stayed on the 5th floor which has a great view of the ocean and the pool area. The hotel next door is under renovation. We didn't find any loud noise that would disturb us in any way. The staff were nice and prompted with all of our requests. The bathrooms were clean. The kiddie pool was cloudy and dirty looking. The adult pool was fabulous. We spent most of the time in the adult pool and the beach. Nice beach, with lough chairs every where. It was not crowded at all. The location was great. It was down the street to a shopping strip (Applebees, popeyes, pizza hut) We didn't eat there since it was too american for us. We wanted more puerto rican so we would drive to San Juan or other cities for lunch and buy food for dinner. We also went to Amigo (Walmart owned) grocery store not too far from the hotel and bought some snack, beers, and grocery. Don't forget to buy some puerto rican coffee back... They are good and they sell them at Amigo. Found some nice souvernirs at Walgreens. We didn't have time to go to a proper souvenirs shop. Would definitely come back when the kids are bigger to do some real exploring of puerto rico. So, basically, if you're down with comfort, laid back, and no worries, this is the place.
