Little kids (mine are 5,2, 1) had fun here. I would just come here just for the beach. If you're looking for party, night life, and loud young people in bikinis... this is not it... you'll see grandparents with their grand kids, families, little babies.....That's why we went there in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing hideaway”
Reviews.Author: Elana31
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt Hacienda. This is certainly not the fanciest hotel but it had everything we needed and was a good location- outside the hustle and bustle of San Juan or the typical resort areas but convenient enough to all the activities we were interested in (i.e. rain forest, kayaking, etc.). The beach at the hotel was incredible-probably the best one we saw anywhere on the island! You really do need a car to stay here though.

Reviews.Title: “this is the place”
Reviews.Author: flowman69
Reviews.Content: the place is great ,i dont know about anyone else . But i did relaxe and rested i work hard and im always looking for a place to unwind . i found it i would return again we only had one problem . the elevators broke down ! and the ataff went all out to help me . they even sent me help to bring my stuff down . the front desk staff not only went out of thier way to help you . they would talk to you I have been to plenty of resorts . you ask a question they answer it and blow you off. this place they talk to you like a person .im already going on line to book anothr week . well got to go to work see ya

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing trip”
Reviews.Author: starkey1981
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. We wanted a place to 'relax and get away' from it all. This is the place. It's a shame that the hotel next door is no longer open and 'walled off' since the pool areas were 'one in the same' at some point in time. But, that didn't make the stay bad. In fact, it seemed to make it better. Pool, hot tubs, and beach were AWESOME!!!! Plus, we were here during Hurricane season and so the weather was iffy on some days, but mostly it was just relaxing!! Choose this hotel is you want seclusion, a great staff (SOOO accommodating and friendly) and a really relaxing stay!! The rooms were in good shape and we couldn't have asked for a more relaxing trip. Hope the hotel (which seems to be going through some sort of reno next door) reopens and again 'shares' pool areas so that they both are successful!

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time but marred by incident”
Reviews.Author: Geri168
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this Hyatt. We found the hotel to be nice and quiet. We enjoyed the beach and the pool without the crowds. We were there with 3 other families so we made it alot of fun. An incident during our vacation upset the remainder of our trip. Our son left his camera by the ping pong table and when he came back it was gone. Granted it was wrong of him to leave something valuable behind, but we would think that someone would be decent enough to return it. We reported it to the front desk and was told that they would call if anyone dropped it off. We did not receive a call, but we did check each day. We are very sad to lose those pictures and the camera and it ruined our time on vacation. It was difficult to look at the other guests and employees and keep thinking if any of those people kept the camera. We hoped that person would do the decent thing and return the camera, but we returned home without it. Again we were having fun until this incident.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt's Forgot this resort ! Wake up and spend the money owners give for maintainance ...”
Reviews.Author: Farmacist1
Reviews.Content: I am an owner of Hyatt Resorts. I just gotten back from Hyatt Hacienda Del Mar as my second vist with my wife and two kids and 2 family friends. My first visit was 4 years ago. The difference is astronomical. The place is extremely dirty and run down. Rooms are dusty, mold in the bathrooms, hair behind the doors and just dirty. Mattress was so old, we could feel the springs. All old equipments and nothing is being kept up. They closed down the lazy river because Hyatt sold the next door building including the lazy river and the pools except ome olympic pool !!! Still advertised on the picture of their website (falce advertistment). Service was just ok. Only one reseurants on the beach... food is cheap and horrible. The one and only good thing about this about this resort was the beach !!!! NOTING ELSE ... This is no longer a HYATT with no standards of any rate.......It might pass for a 2 star hotel !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, I would go back again”
Reviews.Author: alextm21
Reviews.Content: During my stay this past weekend at the Hyatt Hacienda del Mar at Dorado I got a really good stay. Here I go with the positives and the negatives about my stay at the Hotel. Positive: â€¢ The personnel and the service was good from the moment that we arrive until the moment with check out. â€¢ The pool was a good place to relaxed and it was open 24 hours. They have 2 Jacuzzis, on pool for kids and the big Olympic pool. If you donâ€™t mind to have a kids running around the pool, you will enjoy the pool. â€¢ The room was clean and with everything they say it would have. I got the big room, with one king bed, full kitchen, 2 tv, one sofa bed, Jacuzzi, pool and beach view (floor 5). The would go and made room service every day, leaving new towels. â€¢ Free towels at the pool â€¢ The food at the Beach Bohio was good and decent prices, they offer breakfast, lunch and dinner, donâ€™t need to buy food outside. â€¢ For people that like playing Golf, Tennis, Basketball, Ping Pong and Beach Volleyball, they got good courts to do that. â€¢ If you want a smoke free environment, this is the place for you. If you are a smoker donâ€™t bother go there. Negative: â€¢ The hotel looks old, but itâ€™s a old hotel so, donâ€™t expect a 5 star hotel view. â€¢ Only one security guard was harassing people by the pool. I know that the pool say no diving, but everyone was doing it so I took one dive and she went right directly to me in a bad mood saying that thereâ€™s no diving, I just ignored here and continue talking to my wife and she the guard keep stand by pool side expecting me to react to her, but from my side no reaction so she leave, then a few minutes after that I saw here stopping people walking to ask what the were doing, thatâ€™s from me is a red card for here, but beside that â€œsecurity guardâ€� the rest of the personnel was good. â€¢ The Beach Bohio (the rest.) closed around 8:00 pm (the kitchen) and the bar closed around 8:30 pm, they should be open until 10:30pm kitchen and the bar until 11:00pm at least. â€¢ The hotel by the side the former Cerro Mar Beach Hotel is closed and makes the Hyatt Hacienda del Mar looks a little bit uglier than really is. I ask about what are the plans for the hotel and they really donâ€™t know. â€¢ Free parking, but the parking near the golf course is deteriorated Beside those things, I would recommend this hotel for people that just want to relax in a place near the beach with pool 24 hours, near of shopping malls, restaurants, movies theater and other amenities that the town of Dorado has to offer, about 25 minutes from a San Juan, I thinks this would be the place for you, but if you are looking for a Party mode hotel or expecting the 5 star hotel, you should search another place.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed! Not the Hyatt quality and service we expected!!”
Reviews.Author: family1st_89
Reviews.Content: We had fun on this vacation because of company, my family and my sister's family, and the places we visited in PR, but we were so disappointed in this Hyatt resort. This not the Hyatt quality and service that we have always had in previous vacations. The place is outdated and it is next door to an abandoned resort covered by a green tarp, such an eye sore!! The restaurant by the pool has poor quality of food and service is very slow. The rooms are poorly maintained, outdated and not that clean. Over-all resort service is poor. I had so much confidence in Hyatt until I went to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “It was relaxing despite the weather”
Reviews.Author: PWRBECKS
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at this location mainly because as a child I spent a lot of time there when it used to be the Cerromar Hotel and also at it's sister property the Dorado Beach. I was sadden to see what had become of the Cerromar's main building and pool which is now abandoned. However, I was pleasantly surprised that the beach remained as beautiful as I remembered. I stayed at a studio apt, the room was clean, the A/C worked, had a safe in the room, washer and dryer available, and other amenities. The pool area is large, with two Jacuzzis, ping pong tables, and a pool/beachside cabana restaurant/bar with limited breakfast, lunch and dinner menu. The weather did not cooperate much since there were a few tropical waves looming in the area. However, I was able to relax and have some quiet time which is what I wanted. I feel bad for those guest that experienced bad service, as that's not typical for the island. Dorado is a small town with nice beaches, really accessible to the SJ nightlife and fine restaurants, also accessible to shopping outlets and other recreational activities. If you are looking for an active scene hotel stay this is not the place for you. If you want to chillax for a few days by all means stay here.

Reviews.Title: “This place !a dump!”
Reviews.Author: TSBN22
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not meet the expectations of other Hyatt properties I have visitied. The rooms smell old and musty. The room had cobwebs. It is a dated property. The beach was unremarkable. It is best suited for locals with families. It is quite a way from San Juan. . I would not recommend this hotel to any of my friends looking for an island vacation getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: AdventureMillie
Reviews.Content: We initially booked another private home in Dorado for our honeymoon. Upon arriving in Puerto Rico we checked our voicemail to hear that our booked accommodation was "no longer available"...and they recommended we check out the Hyatt. We called the Hyatt from the airport to see if there was any availability, and they said that they did and miraculously it was in our budget. We immediately made our reservation and made our way to the car rental so we could get checked in as soon as possible. Here we are, one week later, completely dissapointed with our stay. Every day there has been someone knocking down our door at 9am, asking when we're leaving. One morning my husband answered the front door to find 3 men in the breezeway, demanding to know why he was not answering the phone, which had been ringing off the hook the entire time he was in the shower. Confused, he said he would be right down, only to learn that he had neglected to sign part of the paperwork. The front desk staff has treated us one of two ways: like we're criminals, with complete suspicion, or simply with indifference. On our second day in PR we found out our checking acct had been compromised and drained. We came up with an alternative payment method, and while we were explaining the situation and offering a new payment method, we were locked out of our room and ignored for close to 30 minutes. Meanwhile, they have my credit card and are not speaking to me? When they give it back, they don't say anything and continue to ignore us standing there. After another few minutes somebody looks at us accusingly and says "Can I help you?". "Yes, we need our keys reprogrammed so we can get into our room." The woman then checks with 4 managers to make sure it's ok to let us in. We completely understand collateral needed, but what made our day worse (after finding out our checking account was empty) was being treated poorly while trying to remain communicative with the staff and openly offering another form of payment. The property itself now has no restaurant on site, features a dirty beach, an abandoned property, and our one bedroom suite smells musty. Our expectations for Hyatt have been completely quashed and we're currently considering moving our flight up so we won't have to deal with the daily disappointments. We've found Dorado to be equally disappointing, with local restaurants being unvelievably overpriced and the service poor. We've been eating in for the last 5 days because we almost feel like we're a burden to the residents of the area...although we've made every effort to be friendly and are speaking Spanish. I have visited and lived in other Latin American countries and never thought I would leave Puerto Rico feeling this way. The people, the accommodations, the service...I don't think we'll be back anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “We Love This Condo”
Reviews.Author: JoeBoston73
Reviews.Content: Dorado is about 40 minutes from the San Juan airport. The advantage is that you are an easy ride from the central Puerto Rico attractions (caves, Arecibo, north coast beaches). You can also get into Old San Juan by taking the exit to the ferry off of toll road A22 ($1 toll). If you want to drive into Old San Juan, there are parking garages straight ahead as you enter the city (about $7). If you turn to the right (up the hill to the fort) you should circle around to municipal parking ($1.50 for 4 hours). Avoid parking up the hill as it is very challenging. Some of the reviews for the Hyatt were not too positive, however, we decided to go with the positive reviews and are glad we did. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We requested early check in and late checkout and they allowed both requests. There is an elevator in each of the two buildings and free wifi in the room (slow in the AM, better in the PM). There are two terminals off the lobby for guest use and these are much faster. The only problem I had was SKYPE was great as long as you turned your camera off. Otherwise, the throughput wasn't high enough to support webcam and voice for more than a few minutes. We had a 1 bedroom on the second floor. The view was of the pool and partial ocean which was very good, but next time we would request a higher floor to see more of the ocean. The rooms were very large and extremely comfortable. The bedroom has a TV and a balcony with table, chairs, and drying rack. It is adjacent to the whirlpool tub and bathroom sink with a long vanity and the closet that also holds the safe. There is a separate bathroom with another vanity sink, hair dryer, toilet, and shower that can be accessed from the bedroom or the full kitchen. The living room is very large and has a flat screen TV, DVD player, stereo, and a sofa that is also a bed. There is also a dining room table and chairs, and a large picture window. The kitchen is full sized with all the standard appliances and a counter with two stools. The outside alcove entrance has a stackable washer/dryer and under the sink is laundry and dishwasher detergent provided at no charge. The appliances consist of an electric stove, refrigerator/freezer, over the range microwave, toaster (faster than the one we have at home), and blender. There is a full compliment of pots, pans, dishes and silverware that we dishwashed every two days. The washer/dryer is shared with the adjoining studio and makes packing a breeze when you know you can wash your clothes on a regular basis. If you rent a two bedroom, you get the studio as your second bedroom and it has it's own bathroom and kitchenette. The pool is very large and very clean with many lounge chairs and some tables and umbrellas. It is nicely landscaped and the staff keeps the area very clean. The beach is very nice with many lounge chairs and large permanent umbrella shelters. The beach closest to the hotel can be rough when the tide comes in, but if you walk to your right toward the adjacent closed hotel, the ocean is very calm just before the spectacular rocks at the end. The closed hotel is fenced off by a green fence and is not an eyesore as was made out to be in previous reports. We were told that it was going to be torn down and a new Fairmont resort was going to be built on the site. The area is very quiet at night (our preference) and there are some wonderful local restaurants as well as excellent Puerto Rican take out stands. The Hyatt is a definite go-back destination.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to relax... and relax!”
Reviews.Author: HTravelerTexas
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at this resort and it was exactly what we were looking for. A place with no clubs, no shopping centers or tourist traps... They keep it simple. a great room with an excellent ocean view (Ask for rooms with higher numbers, if not you will end up overlooking a close, condemned old hotel), a private beach with a natural reef where the big waves crash and then smooth into the little bay. The grounds are very well kept and the employees very nice and helpful. If you are looking for big city entertainment, please don't even look at this property. This is 20 minutes from San Juan, Isla Verde or Condado, which for me it was perfect. The bummer is that the bar inside the resort closes at 6:00PM, but if you go out of the hotel, turn right and drive about 8 minutes, you will find a great bar called "El Corozo sports bar & grill"... nice bar with tropical and live music on the weekends!. There is a lot of local beaches around if you get tired of the resort beach. Just ask the employees or any local, most of them know enough English to help you with directions.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: tbearpa
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place on the beach with lovely grounds and got exactly that. The resort is about 40 minutes from San Juan, but there are plenty of signs to make it easy to find. The resort is on a secluded beach, quiet, peaceful, and the grounds are nicely maintained. Easy to get to a supermarket to stock up on food. While it is true that there is not a lot to do there, if what you are looking for is relaxation, that is what you will find. They do not charge a parking fee, the rooms were well appointed and they have a washer-dryer that you share with one other unit in the foyer. We were very pleasantly surprised and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Second time here - it's worth the point value, but no more”
Reviews.Author: amf5300
Reviews.Content: This is our second time here. My husband said it is one of the lower point values for the Hyatt timeshares, so I would say it's worth the points. However, our "home" timeshare is Hyatt Wild Oak Ranch in San Antonio and, even though Texas is our home state, I must say the Wild Oak Ranch is much more enjoyable. We are here now - got here Sunday night. The first room we had smelled like mold and mildew so much that I couldn't sleep that night - nobody in the family could, either. The AC was not operating properly, so we changed units on Monday. This unit is better. We are enjoying our stay, and if you are content with being "self-contained' and do not require a restaurant or much entertainment (except the pool and activities), you will be fine. I was a kid raised w/ no vacations, so my expectations may be lower than some people's expectations, but good Lord, it's obvious that Hyatt treats this property as the stepchild. Here are some of the negative comments I will share: *Floors are filthy (they were the first time, too)...so much so that it's constantly gritty. *After the overwhelming mold and mildew smell, I got a disinfectant and washed all the dishes in the new room and cleaned all the counters. *The sheets are pretty rough - feels like we're sleeping on burlap. *Overall unit is just not clean at all, so go buy a cleaner, do it yourself, and you'll be fine. GORGEOUS view from our room (and with all the rooms) - that is worth the visit :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely. Ask for an apartment on a higher floor”
Reviews.Author: SUVG
Reviews.Content: We're just back from a vacation in Puerto Rico. We spent 3 days at the Hyatt, and then moved on to Rincon (Villa Cofresi). We have two young children (aged 3 and 1) so an apartment is our preferred option when traveling. We knew when making the booking that Dorado was not a lively hub, and that the area is pretty quiet, so no concerns about feeling isolated. We did see some folks taking taxis every evening to Old San Juan for dinner. It's about 20 mins away. I can't comment on any local restaurants, and we didn't dine at the poolside restaurant. Instead we stocked up on groceries at the Grande in Dorado, which worked out perfectly for us since our 1 year old cannot hold it together for an enjoyable restaurant experience. Pros: - Lovely, well equipped spacious two bedroom apartment with water views. We asked to be moved from the apartment originally assigned to us - it overlooked the abandoned building and overgrown garden next door. - Spotlessly clean - Great pool(s) for guests of all ages - Hot tubs - Good gym. The resort was not busy when we were there, so no issues getting on a treadmill during peak hours - Nice beach - Small shop on site for general goods - milk, candy etc - Despite stating in the Welcome Package that there is no daily housekeeping / trash removal, we had service every day - Free internet - Games room for the kids - Friendly staff - Free parking Cons - Gym does not open until 7AM - Coffee is available in the lobby between the hours of 7AM and 10AM. There's a sign requesting guests to limit themselves to one cup per day. Why not have that service all day? Overall a very nice experience and we would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “It all depends on what you like - it's perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: bklynbiker
Reviews.Content: Always the same complaints about the Hacienda == there's nothing to 'do,' nothing 'around,' blah blah blah. Well, if you're looking for casinos, tacky Vegas style shows and karaoke, this isn't your place, it's true. On the other hand if you want a lovely, uncrowded beach, a lovely, uncrowded pool, and pleasant staff, well manicured grounds, warm breezes and are ready to just relax, it's perfect. A well equipped, spacious unit with DVD for nightime movies after a leisurely dinner on the terrace it just what stressed out city dwellers like us look for on a winter holiday. Bring some books, swim, stroll the beach, have a drink, CHILL! And if you really need activity, there's ping pong and a well maintained gym. The spa is quite nice, if modest, also. We come every year or two, and while we miss the river pool from the shuttered hotel and a few of the other amenities, we don't miss the crowds or thumping music from the nightclub! So know what you want and like, and you shouldnt have any complaints if you choose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach”
Reviews.Author: AnnebWarroad_MN
Reviews.Content: At one time this resort must have been very busy. As of now, there are 4 of the 6 buildings closed -possibly for renovation? This property is on a protected bay, the beach is gorgous, the snorkeling is fantastic and best of all- it's not busy!!! You can go to the beach at any time and grab a few chairs or tables. The beach was fairly clean but could have used a good raking. There is a small tiki bar that you can get sandwiches and a few drinks unfortunately it's not open all the time, closes down around 6:00pm. The food was very good though. The workout room was clean and had fairly new equipment, and also not busy. The pool was very nice, water was refreshing-not too hot and not too cold. The rooms were a bit outdated but was easily overlooked as the location is fantastic. Perfect if you want a nice quiet vacation without a lot of people.

Reviews.Title: “Heart Breaking”
Reviews.Author: MGD0003
Reviews.Content: This once a spectacular place but Hyatt Cerromar and Hyatt Vacation Club became greedy. This charge extremely high prices without maintaining the grounds, pools or service! I don't recommend this place to anyone unless you want to throw money out the window. I recommend Hyatt Corporation look into fixing this mess before suffering any additional embarrassing comments.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to expectations for the Hyatt VC”
Reviews.Author: MPMike0117
Reviews.Content: I think we're in line with one of the other reviewers..... this facility is OK and would be the equivalent of a mid-priced hotel, but it's not anywhere near what we've experienced in other Vacation Club properties. The weather was absolutely perfect and that saved the day for us. Here are lists of positives and negatives we discovered: On the plus side..... - nice, private beach - good pool - fitness center is pretty large - decent equipment in fitness center- mostly LifeFitness brand. Good ellipticals. - weather was perfect (70s at night, sunny with 83-84 every day) - nice couple of hot tubs - Tennis courts and golf - Free wi-fi Now the problems..... - We were in a studio, which for every other HVC property is more than large enough for us. This was the size of a hotel room, with a microwave and mini-fridge wedged in to make up the 'kitchen'. No storage for non-refrigerated food, silverware and utensils wre stored in a jar of some sort. - Bad impression driving up.... the facility next door that was supposed to be torn down months ago is still there and that's right in front of you as you enter the grounds. - Our room (6th floor) actually was oriented toward the decrepit propery next door, so we got a great view of an empty hotel and its un-maintained grounds. - It's pretty far from the airport, so you almost have to rent a car. That's actually necessary, since there are no restaurants on the grounds other than the grill that's open a few hours a day next to the pool. - Not much to see nearby. although if you drive back to San Juan there are a few good attractions there. - We weren't aware of this and don't think it's the same at other HVC sites, but there was no housekeeping whatsoever. We had to take out our own trash, fetch our own towels when we needed them. Not a big deal, but very unexpected. - No desk in the room, so my PC needed to share a small table that was also used for eating. - No 'lazy river', which would have been excellent at this property. There was no variety in the swimming choices- one pool was it. All-in-all, we'll probably return next February based on the great weather we experienced. The point requirement was very reasonable, we'll know what to expect, and there are some activities we'd like to try that we didn't get to this time (rain forest, snorkeling, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “perfect view”
Reviews.Author: JennileeRenee
Reviews.Content: I loved my room, ground floor with a balcony and hammock. The little hermit crabs walking around the sand, the shade tree, very secluded and quieter than the sister property in Cerromar.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: needbettermattress
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay, the kids loved every minute. The miniature golf, tennis, ping pong, pool, air hockey, volleyball. The beach was lovely, it's a little rough, but manageable. The pool was great... The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. We brought our groceries, didn't leave the property, till it was time to go. Very relaxing. We look forward to our next stay...

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - But Needs Some Updating”
Reviews.Author: honeymooncanada
Reviews.Content: We spend a week in the Hyatt Hacienda Del Mar. This is a time share property, but most people I think were just staying for the week without a time share. We stayed in a one bedroom unit. The place was clear but things like bedding, curtains and art work should be refreshed because they are showing their age. The room with the shower and toilet was really dark and the kitchen smelled like it had recently been sprayed for bugs. The staff was great - both at the front desk, the pool, and the cleaners. The property is on the small side, but very manageable if you have small kids. The week we were there the place was really dead in the evenings. I think it caters to families with youngs children or golfers who hit the course early in the day. When we were there, there was a small mini-mart for essentials and a beach hut for lunch and drinks - but that is the only on-site dining. We didn't mind because we used our kitchen for most breakfasts and lunch and ventured out for dinner. It will be great once the adjacent hotel is renovated and re-opened. Not sure of the timing of that.

Reviews.Title: “Strange place....Not what I expected from a Hyatt Vac. Club”
Reviews.Author: quinttank
Reviews.Content: I will give you the low-down on this from two sides. The first side is if you are accustomed to staying in other Hyatt vacation club (HVC) properties. If this is the case then this is not like any of the others. 1) Not as well kept. 2) NO activities or any useful guidance on things to do. 3) Not really close to anything (except for some very nice golf courses). 4) Most of the visitors on the weekend were locals....like 80% of the people in the place. We were there Thursday to Monday. On Friday hardly anyone was there and most of them looked to be owners or guests of the HVC.....Saturday was like the scene in the movie caddyshack (where they open the pool up for the caddies). The parking lot filled up, and locals will park three wide if there is room. Other than those things mentioned it does have a nice pool and a great (but rough) secluded private beach. If you are not accustomed to the Hyatt Vacation Club resorts you will find this adequate for stays near Dorado. I do not know what the prices are but I would pay around $75 to $100 a night for a place like this. Now for the three hundred pound gorilla in the room....What made this place so strange is the abandon Hotel and casino right next to it...(literally 6 feet from it). Folks...I would be shocked if this hotel is ever used again. I took some photos of it and looked at them when I got home...the hotel is in really bad shape. It is wide open and rusted to the point that the structural decay is past the price point of refurbishment. They have constructed a 8 foot fence with green material over it to hide the decay of the old hotel...for me it just made curious about what exactly happened or is planned. That is where I started noticing very different stories on what the plan is (from staff and locals). I believe they (Hyatt) lost a boat load of money in the casino and got out to stop the bleeding. The abandon hotel is very big and obscures your view from certain parts of the Del Mar property. Our room had a real nice view of the old hotel, and if we went to the balcony we could look left and see the ocean. I would take either a ground level room or something above 5th or 6th floor if you want a shot at good view. There is nothing to do or eat on the property. They have a little bar out by the beach that serves $6.50 beers and $7 drinks along with some mall food. You MUST have a car at this property. Driving in Puerto Rico is god awful. I was scared for my life several times...and I can drive. I have been to Jamaica, Cayman Islands....Texas, and have never seen stupid driving like this. The roads don't have lines on them and locals will just drive like idiots.....seriously when you get there look at how many of the cars have dents and dings. I was amazed at the poor roads and bad driving...I felt like I was in a third world country. We never found a good place to eat. The Pika place up the road was average and the drink prices were insane. Right before we left a local told me that the El Captain was great...never made it there. Sweet ann cakes is good and the Wendy's right next to it is just like home. I played the plantation courses (Surgercane & Pineapple) while I was there, and they were OK. For the price I would have expected GPS in the cart. The funny thing about those two course was that they were marginallly maintained and there were no hole layouts on the tee signs or the scorecard. I hit through some doglegs I just didn't know where there. So in short...Del Mar is the worst HVC property we have been to by far... Nothing to do in this area...Driving in PR is not for the faint of heart. All in all I would not go back for any reason.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly, beautiful views, pools, and lovely beach”
Reviews.Author: slmgonz
Reviews.Content: The waterfront location was ideal for swimming, sand play and lounging by the pool. We particularly enjoyed the room layout (bedroom separate from living area and kitchen) because it was easy to put our toddler to bed and still enjoy watching TV or enjoying a drink on the balcony. The staff were very accommodating and friendly and happily provided a crib for our room. The only downside is that during the time we visited there were no restaurants on site -- only a poolside grill. There were restaurants within driving distance, but it would have been nice to have at least one restaurant on site. We visited a nearby grocery and stocked up on breakfast foods and snacks -- having a fully stocked kitchen in the room was great! We plan to stay at this hotel again and have recommended it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “what was is NO more.”
Reviews.Author: aplusthree
Reviews.Content: 5yrs ago this was the BEST resort in PR. You could eat in great restaurants, have a pina colada at pool bar,, ride the current down the slides, pass waterfalls, caves and jacuzzi of the most spectacular River Pool in the country,which all ended in an amazing pool overlooking an incredible beach. And then there was the Coco loco slide.HEAVEN!Now all you have is a pool, a deli/grocery, and the green monster- a tarp obtructing the ocean view from every possible angle. It's a ghost town and only had a 40% occupancy. Forget about restuarants, pool activities, bicycles, night life. There's absolutely nothing to do at this resort. It's sad, so sad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyePete77
Reviews.Content: This place is GREAT! i had a one bedroom unit, with a full kitchen and one bedroom. The resort next door is closed, and being tore down in the next few weeks. Its very easy to get a spot on the beach all to yourself, the pool is great, and the staff was wonderfull. If you get the chance take the bike path to the incredible Dorado Beach and enjoy it all to yourself. There is a condo resort which was bought by the Ritz Carlton and is being torn down, but you'll have the whole beach to yourself...completely worth the two mile walk! My friends and I stayed in this resort for 5 of our 7 nights in PR, and would like to return to stay for a whole week. If you're looking for a place to stay to get away from it all, yet be close enough to Old San Juan, and still be able to make it to the West Coast this place is for you. My only negative thing I can think to say would be the pressure of the bathroom faucets, it would spray and splash onto the counter...but thats no problem all.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: osuna11
Reviews.Content: This is definitly not the place for singles to stay. The hotel itself is very nice, the pool and beach are beautiful. Other than hanging out at the pool and jacuzzi, there is absolutely nothing to do. We stayed at this hotel because it was all we could get through my friends time share. They have a snack bar that serves american food and alcohol but it closes at 7pm. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY THERE!!! I ordered chicken strips and a chicken wrap. The server heated up my strips in the oven, meaning they had already been deep fried previously. I barely ate half of one. Tasted horrible! I found a hair in the chicken wrap when i was taking the onions out. Could it get any worse??? I had to yell acrossthe place to get the waitresses attention because she was eating her lunch by the grill.(huge no! no!) She took the dish, sd it wasn't her hair, told the cook that is was probably mine(in Spanish) and then proceeded to hand me the bill, charging me for the wrap. I of coarsed questioned it and she said there was nothing left of the wrap so she still charged me. She ended up removing the charge but was rude and unprofessional stating now I know not to order the wrap next time. Horrible Service!!! Night security guard was also rude to us. The gentleman at the tour desk was very helpful and helped us with directions to attraction. I will never stay there again, no matter how good a deal I get. Stay in San Juan or cities to the east of San Juan. All the attractions are in Fajardo or close to it.

Reviews.Title: “Spend more and stay somewhere nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: lakecity211
Reviews.Content: Honestly this hotel was fine but, not great. I knew this location was away from the attractions in Puerto Rico so that was not a problem for me. The grounds are really nice and there are quite a few activities on the property. However, This hotel is not a typically Hyatt. A typical Hyatt is contemporary and has a luxurious feel. I thought the reason it was only $99.00 a night was because it was so far from the attractions. The real reason is because it is not that great. This hotel was more like a budget motel. I had a studio suite that had a small refrigerator, sink and microwave. The beds were just average with worn comforters. The rooms are dated and the furnishings are a bit worn. All of the rooms are outdoor corridor rooms which surprised me. When I walked to my room I noticed that there were two room numbers on the door. When I open the door I walked into a foyer which housed the two rooms which were displayed on the door. It is fine for families that want several rooms but, not great if you want peace and quiet. My neighbors played very loud music and constantly banged on the wall shaking my mirror. When I called to report them they just got louder. I never used the amenities like the pool because there were always a lot of very loud people using it. My room was far from the pool but, I could constantly hear people yelling. The staff was polite and helpful. It was a decent value for $99.00 a night and the grounds were really nice. However, that was it. This hotel would be nice for families on a budget or for someone that is not use to having much. It is not nice if you want peace and quiet along with relaxation. I would recommend finding a really nice bed and breakfast instead if you are like me and want something not overrun by families. I wouldnâ€™t say this is a bad hotel just not great. If this was a budget motel it would be excellent. However, for a Hyatt it is poor. In the future I would spend more money and stay at a nicer place where I donâ€™t have to worry about the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Embassy Suites down the road instead”
Reviews.Author: teamirish
Reviews.Content: Rooms are outdated. Bed sheets were like sandpaper. If you stay there get towels from the pool and use those as bath towels, they are much softer. Service was average, nothing above and beyond the minimum. Maids came daily. The closed hotel next door looks is an eyesore and eerie. Our friends joked that it looks haunted. We asked the staff about the closed hotel and they said it has been closed many years. It is not maintained and there is debris all over that property (mostly from the palm trees). If you stay in Dorado, there is a great little restaurant called Pica (s/p? maybe Pika) about a block away from the Hyatt. It is FANTASTIC puerto rican food with reasonable prices. It doesn't look like much from the outside but is very nice inside and great food.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Quietness”
Reviews.Author: Helsinki1972
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 times during one trip in Hyatt Dorado. You need a car to get there (there is some buss transportation from/to airport, shops, San Juan, however, for the rest you're stuck). You can get very good deals through e.g. hotwire.com, so it shouldn't be a huge expense to have a car. The reason is that Hyatt Dorado not within walking distance from any shop, attraction, facility. Hyatt Dorado is approx. 45 min (no traffic jams) from San Juan International Airport. The hotel is very nice and peaceful. The rooms are fine and large enough. All rooms have view towards the sea. The rooms are clean and spacious. We had a standard room. It included a fridge, which came in very handy. Room is cleaned every day. We paid 99 US dollars. Parking is free. The people at the reception are very helpful and friendly. For the rest, the staff is "invisible" in the positive meaning of the word. You do not notice them, which makes it all very peaceful. There is no breakfast (! --- therefore the fridge is very handy) served. There is a pool bar, serving lunch. If you like burgers, hot dogs, etc, this is ok. Prices are reasonable. We did it 2-3 times, by lack of anything better. There is a small shop on the premises where you can buy basic necessities, as everywhere, overpriced. The pool area is large and nice. The beach is a beauty. And the biggest plus of the whole hotel and why we enjoyed it so much: even when it is busy, there are so many lounge chairs available! And lots of space to find a quiet place in the sun or shadow at the wonderful beach. This is so peaceful! Whether you sleep till 9am or 11am, you can be assured that there are plenty of lounge chairs waiting for you. What a difference with several other hotels. Towels provided, 2 for one person is not a problem. The hotel is about 10 minutes from Dorado, with some fast food options, Wallgreens and a large supermarket. About 30-40 min. from Prime Outlets Barceloneta (recommended!), about 35 min from Plaza Las Americas shopping centre and about 55 min from Old Town San Juan. All in all, really recommend this place, mainly because it is so peaceful and if you like to enjoy the sun and relax, this is just the place to be (for a very good 99USD deal!) ---> Currently they are either renovating or doing something else with half of the appartment complex (Hyatt Dorado is a time share place) and half of the appartment complex is not open and blocked by a green fence. Some people do not like this "sight", however, I assume you are faced towards the pool or the sea, so...what's the problem :)

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but you'll want more.”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkArtteacher
Reviews.Content: We stayed last week at the Hyatt in Dorado. The rooms (we had a two bedroom suite) were large. Kitchen well equiped. Bedding not new, caulk around tubs old. View out window was of creepy Hyatt that has been closed for a few years. We were on the 2nd floor so couldn't see ocean at all. Pool okay, hot tubs too hot. One restaurant/bar overrun by birds. Landscaping in need of mulch and some flowers. Some of the guests are time share owners, some were just visitors like us. For the price, you really can't beat it. On the ocean, with 2 bedrooms & pool. Location to San Juan & attractions a small drive but not bad. I would not stay there for more than a few nights- but would return knowing now what to expect. Staff was accomondating & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly people”
Reviews.Author: durexj
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week and found plenty to do. The staff is extremely friendly and the location and rooms are top notch. There are nice hikes in the area, like the 3 mile walk to a great restaurant, Hacienda del Sol at the Dorado Beach Country Club. The exercise room is well equipped, and there are tours that you can take of the rest of the island. There is a fine new restaurant less than a bolck from the gate called Pica. Very reasonable and good fresh food. I ate there three times and enjoyed spending time with the owners.

Reviews.Title: “Be ready for solitude.”
Reviews.Author: alaznj
Reviews.Content: Yes, the beach and water are beautiful but everything else is barely mentionable. No restaurants in the vicinity or at the hotel. Only one bar, at the pool, and it closed by 7pm, sometimes earlier. However, it did serve munchies and burgers. Since there is no night life or dining at the resort be sure to rent a car. Waiting around for taxis is bothersome. But watch out for crazy drivers. The local supermarket is 10 minutes by car. Stock up and plan to cook. Applebee's and plenty of fast food also 10 minutes away. This is not the place for you if you are looking for action. If you are content with sunning, golf, tennis, and cooking, this would be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Depends what you want?”
Reviews.Author: 13Jomama
Reviews.Content: If you want a location that's "close to everything", pick another location. If you want a resort that has all the comforts of home, a private beach, and plenty of peace and quiet - this is the best choice. The beach is surrounded with jungle on both ends - no other resorts or residences are viewable from the beach. The beach is clean with plenty of chairs for guests. The sea was a bit rough for swimming or snorkeling, but was crystal clear and just cool enough to enjoy. The pool and grounds are well maintained. The deserted hotel next door is no big deal. The rooms were spacious and aside from the spraying faucets in the sink, very well equipped and comfortable. The best views are on the upper floors - 5 through 8. If your room is lower than that and you're looking out at palm trees with no way to see the ocean. The staff was pleasant enough. One night I called to find a restaurant that would deliver pizza. I was given the number for Pizza Hut. I asked if there was perhaps another restaurant that served pizza, but didn't deliver. I was given another phone #. I asked where it was located and after waiting on hold for 5 minutes was told, "it's probably in Dorado since it's a local phone number". I asked where exactly and was told, "I really don't know and no one else is here". So much for world-class Hyatt service? Other than that I had no interaction with the staff other than passing by in the hallways or on the grounds. Golf is plentiful near the resort, but very expensive - upwards of $150 a round. As an experienced timeshare user, I know that exchanging outside of the US can sometimes be a crap shoot. I've learned the hard way to go with brand-names for international exchanges or to stay within your own timeshare "family". Therefore, the Hyatt was the best choice. Overall, it was better than other international exchanges I've done, but less than I expected from Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, trouble with one restaurant”
Reviews.Author: PatfromNJ
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hyatt. The value, we thought, was incredible and everybody was very nice. The only snag we ran into was one night when we ordered take-out food to be delivered from one of the restaurants that the people at the desk recommended. The person at the restaurant taking the order was rude and arrogant, and to make it worse the food was just so-so and overpriced in our opinion compared to other local restaurants. The name of the establishment: Trattoria da Nando - it's an Italian place.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but should be a lot better.”
Reviews.Author: skpr77
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week through a timeshare exchange. Resort has some shortfalls that were a little surprising from a Hyatt. 1 Bedroom unit was nice and fairly well equipped. There were a couple design flaws that were a nuisance throughout my stay. First of all, there were food odors from other units coming through the A/C vents. It smelled like someone was cooking right in my kitchen. The toilet system is a vacuum system used quite frequently these days, but I could hear toilets upstairs, downstairs, next door, two floors up and down and further away. It was constant. And finally (in relation to the room) the faucets were aggravating as heck. They were these high powered stream type faucets. When you turn on the water, the force of these little high powered streams of water would hit the basin and by the time you were finished, you had water all over the entire sink and floor area and yourself for that matter. This sounds like a ridiculous complaint, but you had to see it, to believe it. OK, now on to the rest of the resort. Can't complain about the location of the resort because I knew about it before hand. Resort is isolated but also on a nice stretch of beach. The closed down resort next door is definitely an eyesore. They say the resort along with the river pool is under construction, but that isn't the case. No one is doing any work there at all. The beach palapa's are falling apart. I think Hyatt's biggest failure is that there is no real restaurant on location. The one place that serves food (hot dogs and hamburgers) and drinks is only open from lunch time to 6pm. The drinks are very expensive and even got ripped off by a bartender who was making 1 drink for me, when a second person approached and wanted the same drink, so the bartender added only more ice and poured the drink into 2 glasses. So I paid 8$ for a drink that only had half the amount of ingredients it was supposed to have. There is no music, happy hour, entertainment or anything that gives you that Caribbean Resort feel. All of the staff was great, which includes the Resort Manager Ivan who was assisting me with an ongoing problem with my purchase of a 4 day internet plan through Freedom Wireless. Took me 3 months to get it resolved and Ivan continued to offer assistance. I was told they have a new internet provider, but I would recommend that you not buy the internet plan if Freedom Wireless is still running it. All of the food on the island is great, but one restaurant was so good, I went back there again, is Restaurant El Capitan. It is in downtown Dorado. If you were coming from the Hyatt, when you get to the town of Dorado it is one block away from the main road on the right hand side in a little side neighborhood. (This street runs parallel to the main street) I tried to find an address that I could post, but can't locate one. This restaurant is only open from Thursday to Sunday. They serve every Puerto Rican delicacy with a lot of seafood selections at reasonable prices. Family run and they all speak English.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: GAchanta
Reviews.Content: Our flights to San Juan were delayed and so we didn't end up at the hotel till well past 1:00AM. I had called ahead and the front desk had left the paperwork and keys with the one security guard who looks after the main building after dark (if he is out loafing around the property, it could take a long time before you ever find him). The room (studio) was on the 8th floor (requested previously) and the view from the room/balcony was fabulous. The room was well equipped and excellent value for $99. The gift shop is a rip off and the bar/restaurant is a joke. The bar does not belong to the hotel and opens at 11:00AM and closes at 6:00PM so there's no point coming back to the hotel if you are planning on having a nigthcap and don't have your own booze. The pool and jacuzzis are nice. The beach is a stone's throw from your room and very nice. Hector and Melli who work the bar/ restaurant are really nice folks; the food stinks - wraps and chicken tenders - just what you flew all the way to Puerto Rico for. If you crave authentic & inexpensive Puerto Rican cuisine, turn right as you exit the hotel and go 200 yards. You will see a shack on your left called (don't remember) but ask the security guard at the front gate and he will tell you. Food is awesome and very inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Even With Closed Resort Next Door”
Reviews.Author: AuroraIL
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay at the Hacienda Del Mar and had a wonderful time. To me this is a great resort if you are looking for a relaxing getaway. If you are looking for a party resort with a jumping nightlife this is not the place for you. Below are our thoughts on the different aspects of the resort Room: We stayed in the one bedroom unit and found it to be very nice. It had a full kitchen, living room, and seprate bedroom. In the bathroom was a seperate shower and whirlpool tub. We recieved daily maid service were they made the beds and changed the towels and one deep cleaning of the room during our week stay there. As stated in previous reviews the beds were a liitle on the firm side, but nothing that was going to keep you from getting a good nights sleep. Beach: The resort sits on a lovely private beach that is in a cove of the ocean. Getting chairs on the beach was never a problem no matter what time of day we went down. This was probably the highlight of the resort. Pool: Just a standard lap pool, nothing too exciting, along with two whirlpools and a kiddie wading pool with plenty of more chairs around them. The pools were very clean and we could see staff cleaning them every day. Grounds and Acitivities: Beautiful grounds that were cleaned and manicured every day. There was an onsite resturant the served lunch and drinks from 11am-6pm, and the front desk has many menus for resturants in the area for dinner. The acitivites that we saw were: beach volleyball, basketball, tennis, mini-golf, table tennis, and four beautiful golf courses. The basketball court, tennis court, and mini-golf were all lighted for night time play. Hyatt Cerromar: As stated in previous reviews the Hyatt Cerromar next door is closed. The casino, river pool, water slide, and all resturants that were part of this resort are closed as well. If you have fond memories of this resort when it was open, you will probably be disappointed. As also stated in previous reviews there is now a green fence surrounding the entire Cerromar property, but this is only an issue if you make it one. You really don't notice a fence when you are staring out at the beautiful beach and ocean.

Reviews.Title: “lovely vacation”
Reviews.Author: ATLgirl
Reviews.Content: Not a thing wrong with this Hyatt resort. The rooms were large and nicely decorated, and the kitchen better outfitted than I had expected. Plenty of towels, etc. The washer dryer was helpful, too. The beds are a bit firm- we were all complaining of stiff backs by the end of the week, but the hot tub took care of that. The resort is smallish, very quiet and peaceful, and beautiful. Notice that I didn't say "exciting"- exciting it's not. There is little to do on the resort except laze in the sun and drink Pina Coladas. Which I like to do, so I was pretty well set. The pool is big and very well maintained. The beach is small but very nice- plenty of beach chairs. NIce shady areas as well as sunny ones. The fact that the hotel next door is closed really doesn't impact at all (except that there was probably more to do when it was open). That will definitely change when they start demolition and reconstruction, but who know when that will be?- years, probably, at least. The only food on site is the pool/beach bar which has an extremely limited menu. The on site shop does sell a decent array of "basics", and there are grocery stores nearby (though we found the quality of fresh food to be significantly lower than what we are used to at home) Dorado is a sleepy-ish area, but there are plenty of good dining options within a few miles. You will definitely, by the way, need a car. We liked Morado (I think that's what it was called), to the east of the resort. It's high end- pricey, but excellent food and excellent service. There are several other restaurants in that little strip that we did not get to try. There are several low-key, very Puerto Rican restaurants clustered around Dorado Beach (the public beach- not the resort called Dorado Beach). And we went to Charlie-Hamburger (funny name) a couple of times - very casual, very cheap. The mofongo was pretty much the same at all the places that we had it in Dorado, and all of it was good. There are fast food restaurant EVERYWHERE! Never have I seen so many Burger Kings in one place. There's also an Applebee's just down the road from the resort- AVOID IT! It was god-awful. All of the staff at the resort were friendly, polite and accomodating. If you are look for peace and quiet, and relaxation, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Past its peak”
Reviews.Author: jko50
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights at the Hyatt Hacienda Del Mar in Dorado. The grounds around the pool are very nice; however the inside of the rooms are in major need of an update. The water flies randomly out of the facets. There was a musty smell in ours and our other family member's rooms. The dryers left clothes smelling like mildew and put rust spots on them. There is no restaurant at this hotel and must drive a mile to get to one. Ate at some authentic puerto rican restaurants about 5 miles from hotel. Weather was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views, friendly reception, unbeatable amenities”
Reviews.Author: fuggler
Reviews.Content: I picked Hyatt over hotels in San Juan because of the views and the amenities they offer. I was worried about the construction but when we got there, it's not noticeable at all. The fence that everyone freaked out about is covered with a green tarp and when you look out from your balcony, the abundant palm trees hover over everything! I booked our 6-day stay on their website but when I called to confirm on the day of our arrival, the receptionist told me they don't have my reservation. I left a semi-angry voicemail to their manager whom I had spoken to months ago about a previous reservation we canceled due to a hurricane. After a few hours, he called me and said we'd be able to stay there. When we checked in, I was very surprised and happy that they put us on the highest floor - the 8th floor. Our studio cost us $115 a night with the $50 internet fee. It's the best $115 I've ever spent. The studio is spacious and had everything we need. I love the balcony and the views! It was so relaxing eating breakfast with a front view of the ocean and palm trees. There was also a washer and dryer right outside of our room and it was free. All you have to do is ask for detergent. Everyone was very friendly and nice to us. The grounds are well-maintained. Everyday, I saw a couple of guys cleaning the pool and jacuzzi area and different housekeepers. Best of all, they cleaned our room AND washed our dishes every day, and we didn't have to ask. Really, Hyatt is awesome and I'll definitely stay there again. It's half an hour from San Juan, but you can't get a room with a gorgeous view and all the other amenities we got for $115 a night in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: cromga
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at the Hyatt Hacienda on Nov. 27. Hotel was very well kept up and the service from the front desk was great. Pool was kept very clean and grounds very well kept. Had no complaints and enjoyed our 4 day stay with family including a 16 month old. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. Didn't try small restaurant on property. The only draw back is have to go into town to eat. On the last day we discovered some restaurants down on the main Dorado Beach that we had not read about on the internet or books. Might be worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: glencora
Reviews.Content: I am unable to comprehend the critical reviews of this hotel/condominium. We have just finished a delightful one-week stay at the Hyatt Hacienda in Dorado and can find no fault what so ever with the resort. We flew into San Juan (an easy flight from New York) and rented a car. The drive took about 30 minutes. I highly recommend that anyone vacationing in Dorado rent a car. We brought our GPS, which was a big help. The hotel is actually a time-share condominium complex, which probably explains the layout (identical two bedroom condos, which can be divided and all face the ocean), the amenities and the generally quiet and comfortable atmosphere. Our 4th floor condo was a roomy two bed room, two bath unit with a full kitchen, dining and living room, 2 balconies overlooking the pool and ocean and full laundry facilities. We had maid service daily. Everything was extremely clean. Our first day there we ran into a fellow physician from our home town who, as it turns out, bought a time share there when the complex was first built. He has been delighted with the purchase and relieved that the Hyatt next door has closed, keeping thousands of people off the beach and pool area (both very clean during our stay). Contrary to reviews, we were basically unaware of the fencing between our property and that of the hotel next doorâ€”it was covered with unobtrusive green canvas and hundreds of palm trees. Every unit looks out over the pool area and ocean. The pool was large and had swimming lanes so my husband and I could swim our laps every day. The beach is on a horseshoe-shaped cove, which totally prevented trespassers from entering. The entire property is gated and well secured with guards, so we felt very safe. Unlike the experience at most beaches in Puerto Rico, we were never hassled by vendors or beggars. We played tennis on one of their many courts, two of which were lit at night, but did not play golf. There was also a miniature golf course, ping-pong tables and a childrenâ€™s program. The majority of the people there were families (more than 1/2 speaking English). The staff was polite, bilingual, helpful and thoroughly appropriate. Overall, Iâ€™d say it was an ideal vacation week for our family of four (2 teenagers, 2 adults), but quiet. Donâ€™t go to the Hyatt expecting an active nightlife. There are several good restaurants in the area, but no casino as far as we were aware. We ate out every night, but the kitchen was well supplied with cooking utensils and one could easily cook dinner in the unit. There are two good supermarkets within easy driving distance of the hotel and lots of American style restaurants in addition to the local. The town is within easy driving distance of several good tourist attractions: the observatory, Old San Juan, the rain forest and lots of beautiful beaches. But if you want a week in which to do nothing other than sit on the beach, this is a great place for that, too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: PearlCrystal
Reviews.Content: So myself and three of my friends stayed here for 5 nights. We had two ajoining rooms...One was a studio and the other was a full suite. The room smelled stale and we aired it out and bought plug-in airfresheners which helped. Rooms were clean and overall were a good value. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel provided perfect directions to attractions around the island. I had my GPS with me and it could not lead me to all the attractions I wanted to see. The hotels beach is very nice, although beach was rocky on the bottom and my friend cut her foot. The area around the hotel is nice and the hotel is located fairly close to the main freeway. It is also near a grocery store and several good resturants.

Reviews.Title: “HYATT SMELLS BAD”
Reviews.Author: TouringPrincess
Reviews.Content: The room had a bad smell of a moldy basement and so did the sheets. If you plan on staying there spray a freshner and wash your sheet. Otherwise, surroundings where clean, great smelling lobby, nice pool and oceanview, and nice staff. Can't believe this belongs to a vacation club and people accually sign a contract to become an owner here for thousands of dollars. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but hotel is falling apart”
Reviews.Author: xsl1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this vacation club from 9/20 to 9/27. The staff was very friendly, particularly the front desk. However they don't actually do anything. The first night we were there we realized the jacuzzi tub in the room was broken so we asked front desk to send someone to take a look. We asked 3 times that day but no one ever showed up. The outdoor hot tubs were not working though over the week sometimes a couple of jets would work in one of the hot tubs. The beach and pool and were very nice and we enjoyed ourselves. Though everything in Dorado is gated including the Hyatt; security is not tight by any means. For instance, on Friday night, local fisherman took up half the beach. Then the last night we were there we tried to do laundry and the washer flooded our room. The hose for waste water at the back of the washer was not connected and water simply emptied from the washer into the room. Stay here only if you have no other choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great room,but river pool closed”
Reviews.Author: monicacaguas
Reviews.Content: The room was great, extra clean and comfortable. Great view. Bad thing is that when I booked does not specify that river pool was closed. It was dissapointing. Only one pool was operatimg and was not ideal for kids. Only one jacuzzi working. Be carefull with your kids not to loose the purse tag they give them. My little boy lost his purse and I have to pay $15.00 .The mini golf area really needs help. The gym is nice. The sorrounding area is ideal .

Reviews.Title: “paradise”
Reviews.Author: coqui415
Reviews.Content: My family has been going to Puerto Rico for 15 years. We have stayed in Hyatt at Dorado Beach and Hyatt at Cerromar Beach. We now own a timeshare at Hacienda Del Mar and love it. I have travelled a lot and I can't think of anywhere better than Puerto Rico. Hacienda Del Mar has an unbeatable staff. They not only make you feel welcome, but they answer any and all of your questions and really become wonderful friends. I have stayed in contact with a great deal of them. The rooms are spacious and luxurious. It's nice to be able to have the option of cooking in your room, or going out. I would highly recommend this place to all ages (especially teens). I think Hacienda has something to offer everyone. It's sad to have experienced the other two resorts and now see them closed, but no matter what it is a beautiful place (fence or no fence) because let's face it.. you can't beat paradise.

Reviews.Title: “would love to go back again!”
Reviews.Author: bella_1012
Reviews.Content: I exchanged my timeshare through Interval and we got a 2 bedroom unit. First of all, let me tell you that the units are great! It was just my friend and I that stayed there and we both have our own private entrance to our unit. My unit has the full kitchen, dining room, living room, jacuzzi,bathroom, king size bed and balcony. My friend has the efficiency with mini kitchen, balcony, queen and full bathroom. The units comes in equippped with everything you need. Our balcony looked out in to the pool and you can also see the ocean. It was beautiful. I believe all the units has a balcony. We cooked in our condo for the most part. We went shopping at Grande grocery store which is better than Amigo. We had breakfast everyday at our balcony.The resort provides free coffee in the morning! Yummy coffee I might say! Second of all, the resort has a private beach. That is probably the greatest part of our vacation. We went to San Juan beach, Rincon beach and some other local beaches. But we never found anything quite like our beach at the resort. The Hyatt beach was private, clean and just picturesque! It is enclosed by two huge boulders of rocks so you know that it's not open to the public. They have nice chairs that you can use and you dont have to be charged to use them. You can get a nice cold drink at the restaurant and just enjoy the sun. They provide you with towels but you just have to make sure you return them.. that's pretty typical for the most part. Thirdly, the staff are great! We checked in fast and they were very helpful to give us directions and recommendations on places to go. There's not much stuff in Dorado but if you're going out to eat, I recommend the "La Terrazza" for dinner. As for tours, they have them available in the resort but I suggest that you rent a car. Although, make sure to be alert because driving in PR is very different. If you decide to go to the Bacardi Distillery, just plan on going to Old San Juan from there because there's a ferry close to the Bacardi place that goes to Old San Juan for 50 cents one way ($1 back and forth). Lastly, if you're a golfer, you would absolutely love the golf course here! And if you're a runner like us, there is running/biking path that you can take that shoots you off right by the ocean. It's beautiful! It was our first time in Puerto Rico and I must say that I would definitely go back. And I'll definitely go back to Hyatt Hacienda Del Mar!

Reviews.Title: “Too bad about that fence”
Reviews.Author: bikes&boats
Reviews.Content: My Fiancee's family booked this time share and I was able to join them for a wonderful time. They are big sun and beach people so it was right up their alley. We spent about half our week there just lounging by the pools and beach. It is really sad to hear about that fence because we had a great time in January on the lazy river and generally floating about the larger pool closer to the beach often times with drinks either from the friendly ladies at the pool bar or from our convenient first floor suite. I must say it was a bonus to be able to go in and out of the room through the back slider door. I also did this a couple times after dark to use the well subsurface lit lap pool and Jacuzzi. We requested the first floor for handicapped accessibility reasons but even if you don't need it for that reason I would still recommend it. It was eerie walking around the old abandoned half of the hotel with the little bird zoo and landscaped courtyard. I wonder what it will look like after the construction is over. The rooms we nice and quiet. While our AC in the smaller of the two roomed suite worked fine, my fiancee's parent's AC, in the larger room, never quite got their temp right. The large kitchen and living area was great for numerous meals. We also had a few good local meals as well. It was a decent trip into San Juan. Try to avoid rush hour cause many roads get backed up and that is not what vacations are for. We went to the city for the Casinos since there are none in Dorado anymore. Also took a side trip to the big Radio Telescope (with the help of a GPS unit we brought down with us). I agree with comments made by others that those recycled bracelets are kinda scuzzy. With security at the gate, why bother with these?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenialexis
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Dorado always brings good memories to me....I have been there a few times and loved staying there. The check is fast and efficient....we didnt like our room the first time and it was promptly changed. The second room was nice and spacious with a great balcony and beautiful ocean view. One of my favorite things about this place was the pool and of course the pool bar....drinks were delicious and the endless platano chip bowl seemed endless. The location was nice...very quiet area, yet easily accessible by car and short drive away from both Rincon and San Juan. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for a couple who wants a romantic getaway but I am sure that anyone who stays there will enjoy it

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious tranquility and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Mimfiz
Reviews.Content: Even though the resort is not as sprawling as other luxury beach resorts - this is a gem. Service was excellent. Tea on the patio every day - yoga on the beach every morning - a wonderful, protected inlet for excellent snorkeling for my kids (youngest was 9). Even though the pool was small - there was another Hyatt timeshare/condo next door where we had privileges to their immense lazy river pool and wilder beach full of large waves for body surfing and more snorkeling. The first word that comes to mind when I think of this resort is relaxation - not easy to satisfy active children (and husband) and adults craving luxurious accomodations, but this Hyatt was perfect for the entire family.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, relaxing”
Reviews.Author: lookin4boatdrinks
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the Hacienda Del Mar- just my husband and I. We chose this hotel having read many reviews and realizing that part of the resort is closed. We liked this because we did not want the crowds that seemed to be at the other resorts on the island. In general, we were not disappointed. It was nice having the kitchen to make meals and fix drinks to bring to the beach/pool. Not sure if you could do that at some of the other resorts on the island. Did not have to fight for chairs or beach space. It was not crowded at all. My husband snorkeled off the beach and had a good time. Make sure you put on some strong sunscreen though and apply often as the waves were a little rough and he ended up getting pretty burned. The front desk girls were a great help with directions and restaurants. I would definately go back. That having been said, a few things to know. First, make sure you do not lose your bracelets that they give you as you will be charged $15 if they are not returned. They are the same type of rubber bracelets that you can pay $3 to "Livestrong". I'm guessing they are reusing these, which is kind of gross. Also, when you get beach towels you must have them back by 6:00 and get your room slip or they will charge you $25. This was our first trip to Puerto Rico. I was really surprised by the traffic. It is awful- and I live in Atlanta so that is saying a lot. People drive anyway and anywhere they want. We saw several ambulances with flashing lights and no one pulled over. Just a warning to be aware of the drivers and expect people to drive in between lanes and along the shoulder. If you want to go to the east side of the island -Fajardo, El Yunque - it will take you a good hour and 45 to get there. We were not anticipating this. Traffic around San Juan is bad at all times. We were planning on taking the ferry to Culebra one day and the girls at the front desk told us that we should plan on leaving at 4:00 am in order to make sure that we get there in time to get ferry tickets. Needless to say, we didn't go. It is very easy to get to Old San Juan, however, by taking the ferry over. That was a lot of fun. All and all, we had a great time and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Vac Club Travelers Beware”
Reviews.Author: Funfamtrav
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hacienda Del Mar in Puerto Rico. Beware that the lazy river and water slide are closed and have been closed since approximately January 2008! We were looking forward to using this ammenity as our two children are the perfect age. We had heard from family that travelled there last year how fun it was. We were aware that the hotel next door was closed. In spite of making our reservation in November, Hyatt did not have the courtesy to contact us and let us know about this closing. Beware that there is now an imposing chain link fence surrounding the empty lazy river pool and slide. This fence comes right up next to the pool/cabana area and is a big part of your view to the ocean. The beach is beautiful, the condos are nice, but Hyatt not being truthful put a damper on our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not child friendly!”
Reviews.Author: SRTguy
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hacienda Del Mar were terrific. Be careful of the rooms. They are very clean but our original room on the second floor had no view. The window was blocked by overgrowth. The website continues to promote the lazy river and pool with slides. These features were apparently closed in February to make way for reconstruction of the hotel next door. In its place, you get to enjoy the view of a 6' high chain link fence, empty pool and deserted hotel. The Hyatt failed to inform any of its members of the pool closure. The remaining lap pool is very nice but too deep for children under 10. The only restaurant is the pool bar with very limited menu. There are nice restaurants within a 5-10 minute drive but you should have a automobile for freedom. The hotel store has very limited selection of foods and snacks. This place was a ghost town. The property was in decent shape but not up to Hyatt standards. The restaurants, snack bar, and most other amenities have been shut down. If you are looking for a quiet getaway with adults, this is worthy of consideration. If you are traveling with young children, I would recommend avoiding until construction of the adjacent hotel is completed in 2010/2011.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great week at Hyatt Hacienda del Mar!”
Reviews.Author: Lecarrow
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at the Hyatt Hacienda del Mar in Dorado, Puerto Rico. We have been to the location five times before over the past 23 years and have always enjoyed it. Our first visit was in 1985 at the end of our honeymoon, then in 1989 with our then 2 year old, again in 1992 with our then 5 year old (leaving an infant at home) and then in 2001 with our 14, 9 & 6 year olds. My husband bought this week in a 2 bedroom timeshare at a school auction, overbidding significantly with memories of all those wonderful vacations past. Then we started to read the reviews...the adjacent Hyatt hotels on the property were closed, the river pool closed and we started to really worry. Were we off to some abandoned hotel site??? When we arrived we were very disappointed to see the 9 foot chain link fencing and the empty, abandoned river pool. Not only was it spooky but it was very sad, with all our memories! Since this was potentially our last big family vacation now that our kids are 20, 15, & 12 we swallowed hard and decided to make the best of it. So we went ahead and despite all the negatives we had a great week. First of all our two bedroom unit on the fifth floor was all recently renovated, new appliances, new sofa bed, very clean and with a beautiful view of the ocean (although also a view of the abandoned hotel). The one remaining pool that was open was nice and the beach was very pleasant. I did prefer the pool and the lagoon at the adjacent Dorado Beach Club (the former Hyatt Dorado Beach which is also closed) which guests at the Hacienda del mar are also allowed to use. While we were there the surf was very rough for 2-3 days due to a storm out at sea so the beach was closed for swimming. The waves however were amazing!!! The food at both locations was significantly limited, really only the beach bohios at each location. The burgers at the Dorado Beach club were fantastic although expensive $11. We bought groceries and beer as well as cases of water at the "Amigo" so we did have breakfast and snacks in our unit. During the week we ate dinner at the Hacienda del Sol (which was way overpriced and not very good), the Trattoria de Nanda (twice which was pretty good), Applebees and La Terraza, all in Dorado. The best thing about the resort is the golf courses. My husband and two sons played both the Plantation course and the famous Dorado East 6 of 7 days and again although expensive they had an awesome time! In the end it was a great vacation and we are considering buying into this timeshare resort since it has so many memories for us. One very important factor, you must rent a car since the cabs are way overpriced and you do have to drive to restaurants, to the grocery store, to the golf course (which is adjacent but the clubhouse is at least a mile away) not to mention to the airport. Overall we had a great vacatiion despite some pretty significant obstacles.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, what remains of it!”
Reviews.Author: waytoocold
Reviews.Content: Be aware that if you are visiting the hotel, it is not what it used to be. There are no restaurants on site, only one pool remains. The kids pool with the water slide and the river pool are closed! I did not know this when I booked through Travelocity.
