However, the existing pool and grounds were still nice and the beach is beautiful. A bit rough for small children but fun for the older kids. All the staff were accommodating. So much is changing with the hotel and the attached property that it is tough to know what will happen with it in the near future. I highly recommend that if you do go, take a catamaran cruise out of Fajardo - it was awesome for adults and kids of all ages!

Reviews.Title: “will never be the same”
Reviews.Author: ahna123
Reviews.Content: our 5th visit to the Hyatt. We got there just before the river pool closed at the end of January. the barricades were being erected as the Cerromar was just sold. Nobody is sure who wiil operate the new hotel. There is only one pool now. the gift shop/store is closed as well. The property to the left of the Hyatt has also been sold. Not much property left. No more bicycles as they don't own the property adjacent any longer and insurance is an issue. The casino and shuttle are also gone. Only the small outdoor grill is left. The rooms are not kept up very well. mold in the bathrooms and around sliding doors. We thought of purchasing a timeshare but now it is out of the question. Hyatt staff don't know the future of the resort. It was beautiful when it was whole. Major construction will begin soon through 2011 per the staff. we will miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: marriottdc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got married and the previous Hyatt sister property Dorado Beach and stayed for our honeymoon at the Hacienda del Mar. My mom owns a timeshare at the Hacienda and since it was being renovated they upgraded us to the corner unit with the larger balcony and it was unbelievable. I work for Marriott in room operations so I am very picky when it comes to hotel rooms and the Hacienda del Mar is great. The unit that we stayed in had not been renovated yet but it was still in excellent shape. I agree with the other traveler that they are in need up an update. The views were breath taking and the beach was beautiful. The only thing that we can complian about is that we have been coming here for about twenty years since I was a kid and having the empty hotel next door is very sad. If you have stayed here when the hotel was in complete operation you would understand what I mean. It was great for a honeymoon becuase we wanted the peacefulness, however you could see that the grounds of the old hotel were in need of some help. I still cannot understand how they can operate such a large resort without any hotel guests in the main hotel but the staff says that it will be reopened in a year or so. We will be the first ones to book our trip as soon as that happens! Great stay. Beautiful beaches!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: man910
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great and you could go snorkeling on their beach. The river pool was fun as well.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a ghost town”
Reviews.Author: munkelilschool
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a short stay at the Dorado Beach Club (this is what they are calling it now). There are only 36 operating rooms...so as you can imagine this place is very isolated. There are locals who have club memberships, who use the pool and beach and golf courses, but down by the 3 "villas" there is no one around. My boyfriend and I were the only people in the pool. We saw one person walk by at some point and a small family in the ocean, but that's it. There's no where to eat, unless you walk 15 minutes down by the closed hotel and eat at the poolside cafe, which was nice. We switched hotels, because I was going to be alone most of the time while my boyfriend worked, and it felt a little too secluded for my taste. If he was going to be with me the whole time - it would have been amazing. Totally private. The room was great...very clean and modern. Great views! So depending on what your tastes are this is a fine hotel. It seems like this place could be wonderful if they opened up the other hotel and the closed down restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Property”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelstar
Reviews.Content: Ok, so most of the reviews were right on. I think that some people didn't go into it with an open mind. Granted that it is not usual Hyatt quality, but the employee's are doing the best they can with what they have. The Zen Garden has outstanding food and the service was fantastic, Sam the owner is great. The bar at the Cerromar is also still nice. I mean how many bars can you go to and basically have your own private bartender. Make sure and see Roxanne, she is great. She took my wife and I into town on her night off and showed us the local flavor. We had the beautiful beach to ourselves for 2 days. We also found some great locat cuisine in town. Go to the Rancho Mar at the public beach, ask for Janet, great food and very cold adult beverages. Also, eat at La Terrazza, it has been there for 25 years and has excellent food. In closing, go there knowing that the Cerromar is closed and just expect the most relaxing vacation you have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Reto
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 1 week in a 2 BR suite. Let's start with the few negative points: noisy AC (but you have ceiling fans), landscapers in overdrive (constantly working on the beautiful property, often with noisy machines), soft beds, non-existant directions / signs. And in the last night, we had very noisy people above us; constant slamming of doors, you could almost hear every word they said. But other than that: beautiful. Interior had nice kitchen, even a washer/dryer, all appliances pretty new, small balcony. Btw, all units have ocean view. Did not try any of the on-site restaurants other than the Zen (pool restaurant), since with 2 small kids you do a lot of stuff in your kitchen. The various pools (I count at least 5 + one river you can float down + under waterfalls) are fantastic, there is something for everyone from toddler to adult. The beach is a large bay with a reef breaking the (sometimes) large waves. For small children you go to the east end where there are almost no waves. Very clean water, nice sand, perfect. Staff was exceptionally friendly; helped us find a pediatrician very quickly. And - the resort feels half empty. You always wonder where all the people went. It's perfect. No fighting for chairs etc. There a few times when we were more than 25 people at the beach. You do need a car, at least for shopping (go to Amigos, make a right at the corner where Wendy's is if driving towards Dorado Center). There is a little shop inside the resort (charging pretty high prices), but it has the most neccessary stuff. My wife claims the massage in the Spa was great. And make sure you bring back your beach towels by 6pm (they really charge you $25 / towel if you don't). So if you just want to relax with your kids at pool & beach, then this is for you. If you want fine dining + nightlife, then probably less.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: MiaC
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4, with our son being 7 and our daughter being 4. What a great time we had. We rented a car at the airport so we could get around with ease. There is definitely a lot of traffic and I know it helped that I know some Spanish to read the signs. We had two separate bedrooms giving all of us enough space. The rooms were quiet and all have beautiful views with patios. The kitchen/dining area was great for breakfast and lunch. We ate dinner out every night and ate some spectacular meals: Hacienda del Sol - Dorado Beach, Zafra (Plantation Golf Course), Zen Garden (Cerromar) and Morena (in town). The golf courses in Dorado are gorgeous. My husband took our son to play 18 holes at the Plantation Golf Course and had a blast. OK- let's get to the Cerromar being closed. It's a little wierd that this huge hotel which the Hacienda del Mar shares pools and beach with is closed. BUT - it is to your advantage. We had our own spot on the end of the beach to ourselves. For several days we had one of the top pools to ourselves as well. And the lazy river was very enjoyable. I actually cant' imagine how crowded it must have been when the Cerromar was open. If you don't like crowds or crazy scenes - then this is your place. If you like to go away to reconnect with your family- again this is your place. If you like to swim (without huge waves), float in the pool, play minature golf, tennis, exercise, get a spa treatment, read and relax, ride bikes, golf, save money by making some of your own meals....again this is your place. And true it could use updating. They are in the process. Our countertop did have a small crack but we survived. The staff there was very nice. Denise at the front desk was a doll. Also, having a car we were able to drive to Old San Juan and visit El Morro- we did have one crazy night at Senor Frogs. We also drove to El Yunque Rainforsest and saw some gorgeous sites- with a great tour guide. So - I hope this helps you out in deciding your plans. Would we return to Puerto Rico- YES!! Beautiful place. Lots to do!! We will return to the south next time to see Ponce. Adios!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: jaxsgrandma
Reviews.Content: 3-24-07 Our concerns were unfounded. If you don't want to relax on the beach, if you want entertainment, don't go here. Person who wrote about the crack in the counter needs a reality check. We had that room and its very nice. Staff very friendly, rooms and grounds pretty clean but not meticulaous. Nice layout, snorkeling at the adjacent Hyatt Dorado Beach resort was spectacular. Maid service only on Wednesday . No restaurant for breakfast, one for lunch and one for dinner, food at both were great. You need to rent a car but driving is awful, lots of traffic and signage is in Spanish. We own at the Mayan Palace in Mexico and traded with someone here. Service at the Mayan far exceeds anything here but that is about to change since there are now new owners who will be remodeling and opening the hotel and casino. Not sure I'd want to go with the hotel and casino open, probably will be too many people. Beautiful waters, beach and great staff. R&R, read a book place for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Hacienda Del Mar”
Reviews.Author: Love_de_islands
Reviews.Content: Having prepared for the worst by reading reviews - my daughter (17) and I were pleasantly surprised to find the room clean, the staff courteous and the pool and beach well kept. The rest is true - this Hyatt Vacation Club is in serious dis-repair. The grounds are lovely but Puerto Rico in general is the worst destination I have been to in a long, long time. We felt very unsafe in most of the neighborhoods we wandered and the lack of infrastructure and signage to navigate was very disappointing. We own a unit in Key West and there is absolutely no comparison - DONT TRADE HERE.

Reviews.Title: “ALL THESE REVEIWS ARE RIGHT! Both good and bad.”
Reviews.Author: FromNYto?
Reviews.Content: So really, all of the reviews on this site are correct. I liken this property to renting a unit in your grandparents fancy condo on the beach. There's not really room service...but very nice kitchens so you can fill 'em up. You would need a car to get around on your own. The transporatation is spotty. So for families who want to vacation together and want some place the kids can enjoy while the parents enjoy some sun. The property is on a gorgeous beach and there are towels and chairs available. The beach bar serves good basic food and nice fruity drinks. It would not be the place for people looking for a luxury or high end time. There's no bar scene, only one restaurant which opens at night, and it's not walking distance to anything resembling night life. We came to golf--so we didn't spend a ton of time at the Hacienda and when we did --we spent it on the beach.--but did have to walk through all the waterpools and slides. The hotel next door is abandoned...but not really creepy...just a bit of an eyesore. It's weird when you walk through its corridors to get to the one Asian themed restaurant. Pros: Good beach location, spacious suites, great massage in spa, decent work out room. Cons: Not luxury standards, a little grungy, no good food, isolated, spotty car service, a little cruise ship..innot the good way.

Reviews.Title: “Can use updating, but.....”
Reviews.Author: shareR
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Hyatt Hacienda del Mar. Went with a couple friends. Had hoped to stay at the Westin (which I will do next time!) but they were booked during the time we were there. So, we booked the two bedroom at the Hyatt which certainly gave us a good amount of space. We had held rooms at the Hyatt and at the El Conquistador . I had sent the El Con an email and called looking for clarifications and answers to the concerns listed in Trip Advisor reviews and received no response. In addition, the value of a two bedroom with kitchen and living room at the Hyatt (with questionable reviews) versus the single room at the El Con (also with questionable reviews) for the same price helped us make our decision. The Hyatt was responsive to my questions. I believed they were thorough and truthful in the information they gave us prior to our arrival. In addition, they called us prior to our arrival asking if we needed transportation from the airport to the Hyatt, which we did not. I strongly recommend renting a car if staying at the Hyatt as there is not much to do on sight except sit on the beach or near the pool or play golf. Each time upon entering our room (5309 and 5310) we could smell that the room was musty/moldy. After being in the room a while the smell became less noticeable. (Not sure that is a good thing!) Clearly the tropical location makes it difficult to keep moisture out of rooms but it is something that needs to be addressed. In addition, the room dÃ©cor and bedding definitely need to be updated. The Zen restaurant located in the now closed Cerromar hotel was good. We also ordered salads from the beach bar, which were fine. Beyond that, we ate breakfast in our room and most other meals off of the resort property. A Grande grocery store in nearby Dorado was a good spot to purchase items to stock up the fridge. The Hyatt Hacienda beach was nice. The beach is well located with a nice wind (sometimes very strong!) to keep sunbathers cool. Waves can get large and strong, so use caution with young children on the beach. A nice large sand area allows for beach activities. The pool areas, while in need of updating and some additional normal upkeep, were decent as well. Due to the vacated property next door and the limited amount of people staying at the Hyatt, there was no shortage of beach chairs. While I see some guests were unhappy with the staff/service, we did not have any complaints about the staff. We felt housekeeping did a good job cleaning the rooms with what they had to work with. In addition, the front desk was helpful in a number of ways including a stack of printed directions to tourist attractions and a large book of menus for area restaurants that they recommend. I had a service at the spa and found it to be nice. While there are certainly much more luxurious spas, this was pretty good considering the situation of the property. The adjacent property of the former Hyatt Cerromar Hotel is in disrepair. A close look (well not even that close!) at the building and grounds shows deterioration and mold. This situation does not help the Hacienda del Mar status at all. Hyatt had distributed a letter to Vacation Club owners updating them on the situation of the property. Apparently the Hyatt Vacation club had tried to purchase the adjacent former Hyatt Cerromar hotel but the owner of the property is now in negotiations with someone else. The Hacienda del Mar does a good job of keeping the grounds up. I have attached photos of the beach and pool areas. I realize I forgot to take pics inside the room, but the web site photos of the room are fairly comparable to the current state of the rooms. I am a rather picky hotel guest and prefer much more luxurious and more updated accommodations. I would be likely not to stay here again unless the property underwent upgrades. I am surprised that Hyatt has not done so as of yet. However, depending on your expectations, it was certainly an acceptable place to stay if you are not quite so picky, are looking for a good value and a quiet beach location to relax and soak in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Not normal Hyatt Vacation Club quality”
Reviews.Author: michiganderFentonMI
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the worst place to find. Not only is the sign different than the name booked under, but upon entering property you go to check in at a resort that has been closed (no signs indicating it has closed or where to actually check in). The front desk people were polite & helpful however housekeeping was awful (dirt, odor, etc.), not to mention overflowing garbage in the bin under the kitchen sink. We were told that the floors had been remopped after complaining of the dirt upon check in. We arrived back to find the same filth. After complaining again, we were told that a supervisor had remopped yet we still found toys, etc. on the floor & window sills!??! Not a great experience. We actually changed our plans & left from this resort a day early mainly due to condition of the resort. Would not return. Hyatt Vacation needs to check this one out!!

Reviews.Title: “A very relaxing week!”
Reviews.Author: GoTerps99
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Hacienda Del Mar. After reading the reviews we didn't know what to expect but were pleasantly suprised. The pool and beach area are beautiful, and the rooms spacious and equipped with everything you need to spend a week somewhere. My husband and I remarked that it would be a perfect place to bring a couple of little kids as you could pretty much entertain yourself by the huge pool all day. Might get boring after awhile for teenagers though. As many have said before the vacant buildings adacent are a bit creepy. The bar that's located off the lobby of the old hotel (on the way to the Zen Garden) is sort of out of "The Shining"...the only thing lit with TVs and music playing and 1 lonely bartender. Make sure to give her some company while you're there, she's very nice! We played golf at the Plantation course (Sugarcane and Pineapple). You cannot beat the deal they have there (Super twilight starts at 4pm for $30 a person). If it's quiet, they'll let you on before 4. We went off around 3:45pm each time and got in 16 and 18 holes with the amount of daylight left. The courses are very pretty and not too difficult. Service is great. The clubhouse and restaurant area there is beautiful and food very good. We didn't do much all week but sit by the pool and beach and played golf and this resort was perfect for that. We did have a rental car so one night we went out to the Bio Bay in Fajardo and took a kayak tour with Enchanted Island Eco Tours. Highly recommended activity...was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “disingenuous”
Reviews.Author: Catiosca55
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 2/10/2007 and once there we went to our rooms. My daughters room was 5308 it had no air conditioning and the room smelled of mold and mildew. My daughter and her husband stayed with us in room 5307 until problem was rectified. Also, everything at the Hyatt Hacienda Del Mar, Dorado Beach, Puerto Rico is closed but they don't tell you that when ou call them, they lie, the casinos are closed, there is no entertainment at all. All you can do is swim at the beach or the swimming pools. There are only 37 rooms being occupied because this resort has been closed since last year. The rooms aren't kept clean and free of mold and mildew. We also booked the family package which we thought was a great idea. We went to view the Camuy Caverns, in Camuy, Puerto Rico, but what everyone neglected to tell us was that there were further fees involved like $12.00 a person. We were shocked when hit with you have to pay to get into the Camuy Caverns. My daughter was bitten by termites during our play on the miniature golf course in the 13th hole and one of their employees was so flip about it. WE also received a 15% discount card to eat at la Vista restaurant while gambling at the Marriott hotel in San Juan. Unbeknownst to us when we presented the discount card to the waiter we were told that they would not honor it. Then later we heard that it wasn't honored because it was Valentines day. But the ticket clearly states 15% discount dinner only valid after 7:00p.m. excludes alcoholic beverages expires 12/31/2007. Excuse me but these tickets were given to us by Hyatt Hacienda del Mar PER LA VISTA RESTAURANT. So then why did they refuse to honor it? So many things went wrong with this stay. The only great thing was Rebecca the receptionist at the Hacienda she was a love, Eduardo one of our drivers, Mr. Montemayor and Felix. These people made our trip worthwhile. Also we went on a tour at the Bacardi Distillery. Our tour was suppose to leave at 2:15p.m. we waited and were bumped off for other tourists who were there visiting. Why was that?

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: scribeco
Reviews.Content: After reading a few of the negative reviews, we were a bit worried about our one-week stay with two kids, 2 and 4 yrs old. I can now say, without reservation, that it was one of the most enjoyable places I've had the pleasure of staying. We had a two-bedroom condo, which was plenty of room for having the kids sleep in a totally seperate space from my wife and I. THis allowed us to actually have a life after they went to sleep at 8 pm. The full kitchen meant we could cook whatever meals we wanted. The best part was that the resort was nearly deserted. We had a first-class resort practically to ourselves. I can also say that the beach at the Hyatt Dorado (less than five miles up the road and completely open to anyone staying at the Hacienda del mar) is hands-down the best beaches I've ever seen. It's particularly great for kids since it's like a giant salt-water swimming pool. Sure the casino and several restaurants were close, but we could have cared less. We had a car and an enormous US-style supermarket and walgreens 10 minutes away, as well as many other restaurant and fast-food joints in the immediate vacinity. For those who want nightlife and a casino, I would go somewhere else. For anyone else who want to have a world-class resort all to themselves, run down to the Dorado complex and stay at the Hacienda. I didn;t even mention the amazing river pool and what fun that was. Plus, the Asian restaurant and poolside restaurants were quite good.

Reviews.Title: “A small taste of paradise”
Reviews.Author: Mynah24
Reviews.Content: During a family trip to Puerto Rico, we needed a place that would accommodate three people comfortable, as I was traveling with my dad, and my adult nephew who had never been to the island before. We were coming in on the Western tip of the island, but needed a place near San Juan to spend a couple of days. Everything in the city seemed to be either too expensive or not quite the 'resort'-like atmosphere we were after. I found the Hyatt Hacienda Del Mar via various internet searches and was intrigued by the photos and was sold on the great price we got for one full room that would include a full kitchen, sofabed, separate bedroom, and a beach and pool atmosphere. The reviews for the place seemed to be pretty positive, so I booked two nights, and then started looking up everything there was to read about it on the web and in guide books...and started to panic. Apparently the Hyatt properties in Dorado were once spectacular locations, but one of the properties closed down merely months ago, and this one became time share condos! I was worried that the resort would not live up to our expectations, especially since I was not looking into getting into timeshares. I feared long parts of our day being lost to presentations. I almost rebooked the entire thing, but I would keep reading and looking at photos and everyone seemed to really love this place. I called the hotel to be sure it was still in operation, and hoped that it would be what we wanted. My fears were at first relieved when I received a courtesy reminder call about my pending stay --- totally unexpectedly. I could tell by this that our choice was still a first class resort. We drove from Aguadilla P.R. to Dorado in a little less than 2 hours (we took the scenic route), following the directions given to us on the hotel site and otherwise. In the one negative comment I have about the place, the directions were not all that clear. We wound up circling the area in Dorado, winding up near quiet fields that were no where near a beach, thanks to signposts that were not exactly clear. They read something like, go straight on 693, turn on 696, then turn on 693...? Not fun to do when you're driving around for the first time in a strange town. Plus, the Hyatt has not changed the name yet - it still reads "Hotel Cerromar" - which is very confusing when you turn in looking for one thing and see another. When we eventually found the place, we were thrilled. The staff greeted us courteously, smiling, and made us feel welcome immediately. I'm not sure if our arrival (mid week in November) was during off-season or not -- but the place seemed extremely empty! We checked into a huge room that was even larger than I expected, and marvelled at all the little extra touches. TV's in the bedroom as well as the livingroom. A small terrace area overlooking the beach and pool, and a very very large bed. We had wanted two beds, but the cost of a two bedroom would have been much higher. We made the most of what we had, and it was big enough to suffice our small family, only suffering mild discomfort. When we went to explore the beach and pool area, our jaws dropped. The beach was gorgeous. And empty. And better yet - totally private. A lovely view of the ocean surrounded by beachfront is all you see. Nothing more or less. It was beautiful. And the pools were actually a mini-water park! A dozen or so bodies of water all attached via mini-slides. You could use a tube and just ride through a bit and then slide into the next pool, or just do it yourself. Though designed for families, big kids (like my nephew and I) had a complete blast, especially when we discovered small hidden areas (an underwater cave). Again, since we were here on off-season, we had the run of the place almost entirely to ourselves! We were given a voucher to try one of the hotel restaurants (Zen Garden), which we enjoyed immensely -- even my dad who hates Chinese food enjoyed his meal. There were a couple of other eateries here, but due to the renovation and closure of the other Hyatt, shuttles were available to take guests without cars between resorts. The resort is located about 1/2 hour drive away from San Juan. Figure in a bit more for traffic during peak hours. We found a great selection of nearby stores to shop at, had we stayed here for the entire week. A huge supermarket, some additional restaurants, and banks and bakeries are all minutes away from the resort. My dad commented frequently that he felt he was in Florida, not in Puerto Rico. Our stay was short, but we do hope to return here for longer stays some day. There seems to be a management change in progress, so hopefully this place will still be around when we choose to go back. It was truly a small taste of paradise, for a really great price. As for the Timeshare- they do leave messages with you to see their presentations, but they were not agressive about it, and were really looking for couples and families, of which we were not. However, if I were looking for such a deal, i certainly would look into it at this wonderful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, relaxing and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: phenderson
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a five-night stay at the Hacienda Del Mar. I was quite concerned as the sister hotels, Dorado Beach and Cerromar Beach, are now closed, as is the casino and many of the restaurants on these properties. Many reviews were quite negative; however, we found the Hacienda Del Mar to be quite comfortable and still beautiful and the people went out of their way to please us. The pools, especially the river pool, were well maintained as was the beach. The only thing missing was the crowds. Local restaurants fulfilled our needs, but the best restaurant of all was the onsite Zen Garden. The owner, Sam, befriended us and we ate there 3 nights out of 5. The food was EXCELLENT. Sam even prepared a special dinner on our last night just for our group of 6. The theme is Asian, but you still have many choices. First night we ate habachi, second night we ate the 4 course lobster special, and the last night we had our surprise dinner prepared especially for us. The main cocktail lounge is open as is the pool bar/restaurant and the service was outstanding. Everything was great -- so if you are traveling there, do not be concerned -- the place still is wonderful. You won't even miss the casino and you can spend the money you saved by not gambling for shopping in Old San Juan (the Coach outlet is great!)

Reviews.Title: “what the heck happened to our dream vacation site?”
Reviews.Author: cheeseheadland
Reviews.Content: We first discovered the hyatt dorado about 14 years ago and we fell in love with the site and stayed at cerromar and dorado at least twice a year for about 10 years. It was our dream location because of the golf, the beaches, and all the things the resort had to offer. We are truely sad on what has happened. It felt like a ghost town. the hacienda del mar was fine and the pools were operating but the atmosphere has been lost. We had to travel to eat breakfast as well as small items we needed. The rest of the resort is in severe disarray. Roofs caving inn , bathrooms uncleaned , recrational activites closed down, etc.etc... We thought about buying a timeshare when they opened up hacienda del amr and are we glad we did not. Either demolish cerromar and dorado and start anew or just close down. The whole resort is very sad and depressing. I would like to know what the plan is for the grounds.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Dame No More!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sheep2Sleep
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to the Hyatt Hacienda where we rented a two-bedroom condominium. Hyatt has the lion's share of the beach property at Dorado with its three facilities which are available to all resort guests. The grounds are impeccable and the golf courses are fantastic. We want to especially complement the professionalism and skill of the front desk , spa and beach staff . They were extremely polite and helpful, and they will go out of their way to please guests. In every way, they exhibited the high standard for which Hyatt is well known. It is readily obvious that this resort was once the Grand Dame of the island. That being said, we must acknowledge that the resort has fallen on hard times from what appears to be poor property management and intentional neglect from the Hyatt corporate structure. Presently the abandoned, mammoth Dorado Beach Hotel is an eyesore to say the least, and it, along with its rusting roof, is in plain view of the oceanfront condominiums. I was advised by the resort staff that Hyatt intends to begin renovation work on the hotel later this year and intends to complete the project by the end of next year. Get real, Hyatt, this massive undertaking will take at least three years, since the hotel is only one of the many structural problems on the resort. Other buildings, which are not few in number, are also rusting and in need of serious renovation. Even the condos need upgrading with regard to rusting and peeling paint from the walls, fading draperies, peeling paint from porch furniture, an infestation of miniature ants on the balcony upon our arrival, and dirty showerheads to say the least. The miniature ants were also around the pool property. While many of the restaurants are now closed at the resort, the Zen Restaurant is still open for business. We found the food there to lack presentation as well as good taste for such a pricey establishment. We were grateful that we had rented a vehicle, so we could travel to other upscale restaurants. One other point which we noted and hope was not intentional was that the maid service was inconsistent in how they cleaned our rooms, in that they decreased the service the last two nights of our stay--tacky, tacky, Hyatt! Hopefully in time Hyatt will be able to restore the rare beauty that the resort was known for in years past. If so, we may very well return to Dorado Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Families”
Reviews.Author: CNYC
Reviews.Content: Even though it's quite far from the airport, it's worth it. My children were so amazed from the grounds. Imagine, a long winding river pool that slowly brings you winding down to the next sister hotel. The relaxing beaches and a total of 3+ pools. The beach was good, the water was clean and blue. On Wednesday nights, you should bring your childrens to the day camp area to watch movies for free. Also, mini golf, tennis, bicycles are available for use in the hotel. We had fun with mini golf, we used to 2 times. Use the shuttle buses to the sister resorts, which operate every 30 minutes. Overall, we had an amazing experience. We went to the Rainforest, be sure to wear comfortable clothing. The Barcardi Rum factory was quite amusing. Free samples (rum) and soda for the children. I miss Puerto Rico, and I would totally reccommend this hotel 100%.

Reviews.Title: “When can I return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Can I just say I just did not want to leave. We had private drivers all week from Dorado Tours. Ronnie, Peter, Jesus, Eduerado. Excellent. Yes renovatoiin would have made it better. But everyone went out of their way to make out stay awesome. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Never go there again unti they complete total renovation.”
Reviews.Author: mayin
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our two day get away at this hotel and all I can say is that they should close it down ultil they start and finish a complete rennovation. . We as locals knew very well this Cerromar Hotel before its closing and it is painful to see how deteriorated everything is. They should not continue the timesharing program because is very dissapointing to the members not to get what there were oferred. NO restaurant, no casino, no pool bar (except hours a day) no nothing. As for the beach and pools, we have so much better offers and hotels here in P.R. that is offensive to promote this kind of place as a Hyatt, please!!!!!. We reserved this place to be with family from the states that had a timeshare and never imagined the place to be so rundown. To top it all the sister hotel Dorado Beach, who has the nicest beach ,closed down this same week. As I read the reviews of other people today I realized everybody thinks the same way. I advise to look for better offers. Definitely not a place to consider for your vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds a Tropical Delight”
Reviews.Author: JOJOSI
Reviews.Content: My finance and I have just returned from a Curise which left out of Puerto Rico. We decided to stay three extra days at the Hacienda Del Mar. I was very leary after reading some of the reviews. But let me tell you we thought it was delifghtful. The beach and pool and grounds are magificent. You need to rent a car since there is little to do at the hotel. It's a shame that the Hayatt Organization let the Ciromar and Dorado Beach Hotel just close up. These hotels must have been out of this world 25 years ago. I have been to plenty of hotels and resorts and again this hotel was not bad. I found it clean and the staff was very helpful and polite. I want to say thanks to Celia at the front desk for all her help she does a great job. Again we would stay and recommend this hotel

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Hacienda Del Mar
HotelInfo.Address: 301 Hwy 693, Dorado 00646, Puerto Rico
